reviewText: WOW!  I am a very avid workout person.  I consider myself to be in great shape (for a 49 year old!) and Jillian kicks my rearend!  She is a fantastic trainer, great motivator and instructor.  I would recommend this to people at all workout levels.  I mix up the workouts with her Yoga Meltdown videos and her ciruit training as well.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I started the 30 Day Shred 4 weeks ago and am doing each phase for two weeks, 6 days a week which makes it the 36 Day Shred for me but I can tell you it works. I have biceps, my calves are firm when I shave them every morning and this 48 year old woman has youthful looking legs! I see signs of abs and my abs HURT right now...today was my first day on level three.I have lost about 2" between my waist, hips and thighs and have only lost 2 or 3 pounds but I was thin when I started.My body is tightening up big time...Jillian chatters a lot and her profanity is not necessary for the work out. Swearing might not bother some but I don't care for it especially if my kids are in the room listening/watching mommy huff and puff.She promises results and you will get them if you stay true to the work out. I don't know where the diet system she talks about it...I suppose you could lose a significant amount of weight if you were on it...it doesn't appear to be on the dvd.
summary: Worth buying and worth the effort!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I love The Biggest Loser and I have really have began to like Jillian the past couple of seasons. She's hardcore but she knows her stuff! I began this DVD and it was VERY challenging! But after about a week I completed the entire 20 minutes of Level 1 without having to stop & catch my breath (there's 3 Levels)! It's still very challenging but you have to push yourself through this! I think maybe after another week I will try Level 2. And Jillian is motivating in this DVD more than you would imagine. 5 stars for this DVD!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I thought that this was a really good video workout that was clear and easy to follow. It hasn't gotten boring to me yet. Jillian explains things well and the ladies in the back show the moderate way to do the exercise for beginners and the  full-speed-ahead way to perform the exercise; it is nice to have a person to focus on instead of trying to modify things on your own. I don't think starting out that it could be done everyday, my muscles needed to rest a day in between. I do really feel a "burn" (in a good way!)and think that for a video, it is an effective workout in 20 minutes. (No annoying music either!)
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I do like the workouts, I do like the trainer, but some of these moves are hard on the knees! The next day after working out, I had pain and stiffness in both knees, and I know Jillian is a big fan of "push yourself" so I didn't wimp out during the workout. I paid for it the next day. My knees have been bothering me ever since, about two weeks now. I have still been doing the workouts, but am careful during the portions where I feel my knees may be stressed too much. So take a warning if you have bad knees...this isn't for the weak kneed!!
summary: WARNING This workout is hard on your knees
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I've purchased this DVD to give myself a break from exercise bike (boring to do every day) so I now alternate one day of pure cardio on exercise bike and then one day of one of the 30 Day Shred workouts. I've done a level one a couple of times, and first time I have found it a bit challenging since it really exercises your whole body, so I ended up with some muscle pain in the areas which I have been disregarding in previous exercises (my fault entirely, I did level one on one day, had some muscle pain and then decided to just do the bike next day but decided to try some warm up exercises and then ended up doing entire level 2 on top of 10 km on the bike and could barely move the next day). However, after one day of complete rest, next day exercise bike, I was back to doing level 2 with no problem. One thing to be careful about is maintaing the proper form, especially with squats and lunges. If you pay attention to that, it is no problem for the knees, if you allow your knee to go forward too much, that is bad for the knees. In the beginning, do it more slowly if you are not used to it, and pay attention to the knee position. If she says knee at 90 degrees, make an effort to do it right.As mentioned by other reviewers, she is doing 3-2-1 (3 minutes strength, 2 minutes cardio, 1 minute abs) circuits, exercises are good, you get no rest in between but the whole thing passes quickly since you alternate between different exercises. All you need is hand weights and  a mat, no other equipment. I found level 2 to be only slightly more difficult than level 1, and I like level 3 most since you are doing all the exercises with the weights so it is more challenging. In fact, in future when I switch to level 2 or level 1 for a bit of variety I will do the cardio moves there with weights too. There is a bigger difference in difficulty between level 3 and level 2, than between level 2 and level 1. But doing it feels great, very satisfying workout.Some minor gripes - in warming up parts, I wish she would reverse directions (actually after doing it first time, I now know to reverse the direction at about half way for knee circles and similar exercise), doing circular movement in only one direction doesn't seem to be as effective way to warm up as doing it in both directions. Also, the number of repetitions for some exercises is not the same, so I just keep proper count on my own.Also, since I play this on my computer, I just hit "last time played" button which just puts me on the menu screen where I can choose which level workout to do, no need to listen through the introductory part as some reviewers have complained.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I repeat: If you have bad knees, stay away from this video and any other that has you do side-lunges.  I loved parts of this video, but due to my bad joints was unable to do about a third of the exersizes in it.  Look for workouts that are specifically "Low Impact".  There are many great ones out there!It also really bothers me that she seems to chastize people for doing modifications.  I'm sorry but I can't afford knee surgery right now but I'd like to get fit so I *can't* do things like jumping jacks, side lunges, and other plyometric excercizes that are painful and damaging to my knees.  That really turned me off to her as a trainer.  If she's a real "fitness expert" she would know that some people *need* modifications and not try and make it seem like those who do are just lazy slackers.If you too got this DVD and find yourself selling it, try any of Cathe Friedrick's "Low Impact" DVDs- they are very challenging (I sweat like crazy!), low-impact, fun, and you will see results without someone judging you about needing low impact workouts!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I like the instructor.  She's not interested in flashy outfits, make up, etc.  She's there to make you sweat and she does a good job keeping you from quitting. I need for my workout to be fun or I start to get lazy.  I couldn't wait for this workout to end so that I could jump into a more active workout.Still, this DVD deserves the 4 stars for being effective in it's purpose...  to make you lose weight and tone muscle.

reviewText: My DVD, The 30 Day Shred: Lose Up To 20 pounds In 30 Days, by Jillian Micheals arrived last week. Tonight was my first attempt at the work out. All I can say is "HOLY COW! What a work out." Very intense and for people who live sedentary lifestyles like me, it definitely makes you sweat. I smelled like a pig when I was done but I also felt very good. The work out was challenging for me but very, very doable. When my legs were ready to give out, it was time to switch moves so that helped a lot. It has 3 levels of intensity. I honestly didn't think I was going to make it through the entire 20 minute work out but I did.What differentiates this workout video from the others I've tried is that you start to sweat almost immediately after the warm ups. I'm beginning to think the other workout videos I own are more for conditioning and less for actual weight loss as I rarely, if ever sweated--even though I found a few of them a bit challenging. Oh, and that's another thing. This video is not challenging in the way of choreography, it's challenging in the way of how out of shape you are or aren't.I'm on level one. I plan to be here for a good 2 to 3 weeks. I figure with my hip problems that should give my body enough time to adjust to working out and then I can see if I'm ready for level 2. I'll be real curious to see how much weight I lose. And I'll be cheating a little, too. I want to throw in a walking video each day or perhaps Richard Simmon's Sweatin' To The Oldies.
summary: Holy Cow! What A Work Out.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I'm someone who is quite out of shape, but I could still get through most of the exercises in the first 20 minute beginners workout.  I like that this has 3-20 minute workouts that allow for progression which means I can use this for months to come if not years.  I also like the 3-2-1 workout style Jullian uses with 3 minutes of strength moves, 2 minutes of cardio and 1 minute of abs- it of course feels like an eternity while working out, but keeps the workout moving and actually you are moving on to cool down before you know it!  I can't speak to the claim that you "lose 20 lbs in 30 days" because I didn't workout every day.  But I still like the workout, the options that are offered, and the lower intensity example as well as higher intensity example and how well Jillian explains each move.
summary: Great workout for progression from beginner to advanced!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I had been reading a lot of reviews here and at Collage. I was a bit skeptical about this dvd because while most of the reviews are glowing, the ones that aren't REALLY aren't. I figured I may be disappointed since I'm an advanced exerciser (I do Jari Love 3-4x/week).However, since it was only $14.99 I headed over to a local bookseller yesterday and purchased it to start my own June 30 day shred today. reviewText: I began using Jillian's 30 Day Shred as soon as I was cleared by my OB to workout post-baby (6 weeks). I measured my waist, hips, and thigh prior to starting and am happy to report that after doing the video for 15 days, I've lost 2 inches from my waist, thighs, and hips! This video, along with an occasional afternoon walk or yoga/pilates, and a healthy diet, helped me get back to my pre-pregnancy weight by the time I was 9 weeks post-partum.What I like about this video is that there are 3 workouts of increasing difficulty so that your body is constantly being challenged. Also, these workouts can be done in less than 30 minutes (a major plus when you are taking care of a baby) and you definitely feel like you have had a total body workout. Also, modified versions of of the exercises are provided (just follow Anita). I spent 10 days on each workout before moving on. I used 3 lb weights for the first 5 days of each new level and followed Anita who did the modified versions of the exercises. By the time I hit day 6 of each new workout I upgraded to 5 lb weights and tried to follow Natalie as much as possible.This workout is tough (intermediate level exerciser) but well worth the effort!
summary: Should be called "Blast off that baby fat!"

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: It's a great "kick my butt" workout for any level. Especially if you are willing to put yourself back in shape, but don't know which way to start. It's for both men and women. Here you have three 20 minutes workouts sessions, level 1 - 2 and 3. Each workout has 3 different 3-2-1 minutes circuits. 3 minutes strength, 2 minutes cardio, 1 minute abs. She reaches for the main group of muscles, legs, abs, arms, shoulders, waist, and upper back. For the cardio part, she mainly uses jumping jacks, and all sorts of jumps. For the strength she goes heavy on squats, lunges, pushups, biceps and shoulders. For abs she uses crunches and reverse cunches. Each level increases progressively. I have 8 pounds to loose and I was pretty much out of shape when I started. I achieve to decrease my body fat level from 31.4 to 29.4% in 30 days of non-stop training (I am wishing for 22% level of fat) but I actually put on 2 pounds. I guess it's due to the muscles that I built up, since muscles are heavier than fat. I couldn't tell that I felt my muscles the day after the workout eventhough I pushed myself full force. I enjoyed the fact that it only last 20 minutes and I enjoyed sweating all the way. I knew I could not keep up with a 1 hour cardio and strength workout at this stage and I was happy to have purchased this tough 20 minutes workouts. It has proven to be effective and, for the price, it's really worth it. However on the long-term use I will change my routine. Firstly I want to do 1 to 2 hours workout a day and I want to do a different type of workout everyday. I want a workout that also reaches smaller muscles group. I want definition, long and lean muscles strength and flexibility. Also, I do not want to bulk up, as this is a typical bulk up workout. I do not want to kill my knees and joints with constant high impact jumps. The workout itself is not really creative, it's really about basics and for a lover of workouts like me, I seek for a little more sophistication. Jillian is great and fully committed to the results, trust she won't let you down. She might sound a little manly but it's her way. I bought two Jillian's workouts at once, but I most probably won't buy anymore of Jillian's workout as I'm seeking for a different style of workouts.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Wow!  This is a great workout!  I believe doing this dvd every day helps get me ready for the day and for the next work out.  I'm 48 so I started sort of with low impact, I try to throw in high impact as much as possible.  I have to keep in mind, don't push it to the point of hurting yourself because then you won't be able to do it again for awhile.  The first 10 days of Level 1, I felt so great.  By the 4th day, I was doing high impact.  By the 7th day I could feel my strength building on the workouts.  Now I'm 6 days in to Level 2 and I feel so much stronger.  I know I'll finish this and then I'll start over.  When I start over, I'll make the workouts more high impact, I'll push myself harder.  I'll go lower on the push ups, I'll reach higher on the sit ups, etc.  I'm sore, not a painful sore, a worked sore.  I feel great.  I have more energy.  I'm too tired to snack - lol!My husband says he definitely sees definition in my sides.  I am also doing weight lifting 3x a week at home, free style.  I also am using a variety of Jillians other dvds on the days that I don't lift weights.  So, for instance today, I did the 30 day Shred this morning and then lifted weights for 2 hours - then I'll go walking after work.  Tomorrow, 30 days shred and then Jillian's 6 Week 6 Pack, Thurs will be 30 Day Shred and then Banish Fat Boost Metabolism, One of the weight training days, I also do the No More Trouble Zones.  I'd love to have all her dvd's.  I just don't know when I'd work them in right now.Keep bringing the great workouts Jillian!Update:  Mar. 6, 2013:  I'm on Level 3 now:  I spent the past couple days with a virus (I believe) which attacked the muscles.  It didn't help that I worked out everyday - hard - for 7 days straight and didn't take a day off. I tried to lift weights, too sore and too tired to stick with it.Wednesday, today, I did Level 3 of 30 Day Shred but at the lowest level you can imagine. For instance, walking planks were done on my knees including the traveling push ups, the jump squats and rock star jumps were just getting my feet off the ground so basically a low level jump rope effort, (lol) scissor crunches involved my feet higher in the air - instead of a few inches from the ground, I was able to do the alternating punches holding dumbbells in the squat position, the butt kicks with dumbbells was basically getting my feet off the ground - bending my knees just hurts while jumping (hence, achy muscles) - I feel bruised still from the virus, the alternating jumping lunges were just low level lunging forward and back. It felt like it went quickly.I'm glad I did it - I worked up a sweat - I'm going to do a walking dvd next. Instead of spending 10 days on level 3 I believe I'll spend 13 due to the virus making me do it at such a low impact. I'm glad I did it!
summary: Push yourself - you will see results

reviewText: I've been doing this for 1-2 months now, though not every day as it's too hard on my knees. The workouts are REALLY hard and actually more than 20-minutes; more like 25-minutes. I sweat PROFUSELY and have to switch to the easier/beginner modified exercises in all 3 levels for a few of the moves. I'm in my 30s, have had 2 kids & am 5-10 lbs overweight (5'5" & 135ish lbs); just stopped exercising after kids though I used to run. I actually take a break from these videos to run on the off days. Jillian does a lot of planks, pushups & weights, plus jumping jacks & lunges. Yes, you will feel like you are going to die. I thought I was going to throw up a few times. My husband plays basketball but even he had to take a break & couldn't make it through the whole thing without stopping. Great, intense workout & best exercise DVD I own because it combines weights & cardio & abs plus offers 3 levels that get harder as you progress. I'm definitely more toned (abs feel hard now) & lost 3/4 inch around waist in a month though I'm not doing the diet part and not doing it every single day. I plan to keep going!
summary: Tough & intense but gets the job done no matter what shape you're in

reviewText: LAYOUT OF REVIEW:-intro-eating habits & tips-Session # statsHey everyone!  I'm going to be coming back to this review every other week or so to post my results as I go through Jillian's 30 Day Shred (1 work week each of Levels 1-3, repeat).  I can tell you that after ONLY 6 sessions, I zoomed into Target and shopped for my first real MIDRIFF BARING swimsuit because I could now fit into one without being ashamed of my figure and it's now hanging on my closet for inspiration to be thinner this summer.  Keep in mind that I haven't been a saint about doing the workouts either; I did 3 days of Level 1 and on my 4th day of Level 2 and I'm still seeing results.Here are my eating habits just for background knowledge and some may help you: I drink as much water as I can (NO SODA POP!); I eat smaller portions fit for children; if I eat at a fast food place, I order a plain hamburger OR grilled chicken sandwich sans mayo OR grilled chicken salad; if I'm hungry during the day, I always have wheat crackers with peanut butter handy (PB is amazing for this diet); I don't eat past 8pm so I'll be hungry in the morning to get my metabolism going (usually waffles w/ PB & honey).  Quick tip: my mom cut out HIGH FRUCTOSE CORN SYRUP from her diet and lost over 30 POUNDS, I lost some, and we both have more energy, so cut out as much candy and processed foods as possible!!!!!  As for baked goodies that are "better" for you than corn syrupy candy, only have a teeny weeny bit to satisfy your sweet tooth, because if you're like me, once you think about something sweet, you crave it and will go overboard if you deny yourself, so only have enough to not go crazy.SESSION 1 STATS: petite 5'3", size 12 pants, 151 pounds (I look 20 pounds smaller than this sounds, really); trouble spots (being shorter, I have lots of these): muffin top, larger thighs, love handles, upper ab flab.SESSION 6 STATS: size 10 pants (my size 12 jeans are getting irritatingly baggy), 149 pounds; as for trouble spots: muffin top is DEFLATING, thighs are beginning to get a GAP in between them, love handles are SHRINKING, and my upper abs are SMOOTHING OUT nicely.  Other effects by this time: butt is SHAPING UP and lower legs are TONED.  Also, my usually-muscular arms are even more so in a healthy-looking way (not like a lady body builder--ick).  I guess not many women have this, but I've usually had defined obliques (even when heavier---weird) but the workouts have made them even deeper.SESSION 9 STATS: Size 10 pants. 151 pounds but this is muscle mass, I believe, because I look much leaner than a few sessions ago. My back is more TONED and face is THINNER.  My energy is up and moving around at work is much easier.  Back to the bottom: my butt is not that big bump anymore, but it is TEARDROP-SHAPED now!  And keep in mind, people, that all this is after only 2 weeks of total workouts.SESSION 13 STATS:  Size 10 pants are getting looser!  Gained weight, but that is fat-eating muscle, and the fat around my middle and on my thighs have been MELTING AWAY.  Be wary that if you're like me, you'll crave large portions and fatty foods (say, Pizza Hut like we had last night!) once the workout is over, so stick to fresh produce, grains, and yogurt.  My lower abs are much FLATTER and when I sit in a chair (when women are at risk for the ugly muffin top!), my stomach barely goes over the top of my jeans.  I'm still having trouble getting rid of my love handles completely, so I'm experimenting by eating only Cheerios and yogurt for breakfast and lunch, then a regular LOW-FAT dinner.  I'm guessing the bad or excess fat I take in goes straight to the love handles, so it's time to put a stop to that!SESSION 17 STATS: Still in size 10 pants, but those are starting to get looser, as well.  My arms around the shoulder area are NO LONGER BULGING, the gap between my thighs is bigger, arms are seriously TONED.  However, I'm still battling my midsection to keep up with the rest of my body.  This isn't a negative about the program, I just need to reduce calorie and fat intake to make my body burn what I've already got.  Level 3 certainly fires up the furnace!OKAY....I've had to start over because I let "busy" get in the way and I'm dearly paying for it.  Here's what happened:---you probably lost weight, but the week you have to stop for woman issues or just stop for any old reason, you're body may gain the weight back as upper abdominal flab (as fat redistributes on your body).  If you stop, you may crave very unhealthy foods.---SO, to begin again, you'll have renewed cravings for healthier food and it should be easier this time around because instead of getting rid of the stuff you lost in the first place, you're trying to lose MORE, and the results will be more gratifying.One more WARNING: there are tons of squats and lunges in this DVD, so your knees will ache quite a bit as long as you do these workouts.  When I stopped, I realized my knee pain was gone, so it is back and definitely from this workout.

reviewText: This is a great workout that totally gets my heart rate up, my muscles toned & brings my physical abilities to a new level.Level one wasn't too bad except for all the pushups in the first circuit.Level two lasted me a while and I was really proud of myself when I could finish it & not feel completely destroyed. The military press with leg extension & the V-raises were brutal as were the oblique twists & skaters. But it was a success to do them 100% and see my muscle tone come back into view.The only thing I didnt like about levels 1&2 is that all the lunges tended to hurt one of my knees that has given me trouble in the past.Level 3 is definitely a rise above the rest and I've only done it 2 times so far. The strength moves are based less on the weights and more on overall body strength- traveling pushups, jumping lunges (which actually didnt bother my knee as much which surprised me) so it challenges your entire body & is almost like doing cardio even though it's in the strength circuit.My only concern is that after I conquer this 3rd level I will be looking for a new challenge. I do 25 minutes of Taebo beforehand and sometimes do another 25 minute Taebo ab workout afterwards, so I hope that is all enough for me to get in killer shape.It's great to get such a good workout in the house (there is A LOT of jumping so if you have a squeaky floor or live above someone else it could be an issue for you), i'm not a jogger and I'm not interested in buying a cardio machine.My only pet peeve about the video is sometimes Jillian says "almost there" and it keeps going and going as if she said it at the half-way point, so mentally I'm thinking we're about to change the exercise and we keep going much longer than expected which frustrates me.But for 10 bucks - you cannot beat this workout. I'm totally glad I bought it.

reviewText: I'm a physical therapist, so I know how to work out, but I use home fitness DVDs a few times a week because sometimes I need motivation from someone else.  I'm very critical of these workouts though; there are only a handful of instructors who I think teach with good form and cueing.  This was my first Jillian Michaels DVD and she is absolutely on that short list - great instructor!THE INSTRUCTION:  Jillian and her two friends all have excellent form on every single exercise.  I appreciate this because the girl who shows the modified moves (Anita) is very fit and does the moves perfectly - this is important for a beginner to watch!  (I hate when the most unfit person on the DVD shows the modifications - that does the true beginner no favors.)  I enjoy Jillian's no-nonsense style of motivation - she gives it to you straight ("You don't get abs like this for free", "You can't rest during a 20 minute workout and expect results", etc) but she's not scream-y or drill instructor-y.  She explains her 3-2-1 philosophy clearly (more on that in a bit) and she's absolutely right that combining strength with cardio is the most efficient way to work out.  She's also right that you can't take a break in such a short workout, but don't take that tooooo literally.... I do take 5 second breaks between circuits to sip water.  All in all she is tough, but she knows what she's talking about.THE FORMAT:  There are 3 self-contained 20-minute workouts.  Each one follows this format: 1 minute of warm up, three different 6-minute 3-2-1 circuits, 1 minute of cool down.  The 3-2-1 circuits are: 3 minutes of strength using hand weights(30 seconds of a 'serious' exercise + 60 seconds of a compound - legs and arms - exercise, twice through) + 2 minutes of cardio (30 seconds of cardio + 30 seconds of another cardio, twice through) + 1 minute of abs on the floor.  The 3 20-minute workouts are designed to progress you through different levels of fitness: start with level one for a few weeks, then level 2, then level 3.  In my opinion, this is a well-designed and and very time-efficient way to workout, and it moves along at a nice pace that doesn't get boring.Two things I love about the self-contained workouts (as opposed to mix-and-match style): 1- You don't have to choose between toning and cardio, one workout has both, and 2- Once you are bored with Level One, you don't just keep doing it with add-ons to do Level Two... you have a whole new workout to do.THE EXERCISES:  The strength moves are basic and effective.  I like that they are separate from the cardio moves (you put your weights down for cardio and abs - except in one circuit of level 3) because that's safer for your joints.  They include exercises like (a variety of)push-ups, rows, bicep curls, flys, chest presses, etc, and the 'compound' moves combine upper body exercises (like the bicep curls)  with squats and lunges to keep bigger muscle groups working and fat burning. If you're strong, you could use some heavier dumbbells here because the instruction is excellent and the moves are controlled and safe. The cardio starts out as moderate impact - jumping jacks, butt kicks and the like.  Jillian does not show low impact modifications here because she wants people to push themselves.  I agree, to a point.  But people with bad knees or backs, in my opinion, should stick with low impact versions of these moves.  (If this is the case for you, I would caution you not to do this DVD if you have never exercised before.  Take some classes or do some DVDs that do show low impact modifications - then you can modify Jillian's moves yourself.)  In levels 2 and 3 Jillian makes the cardio more intense - including plyometrics (jumping) like squat thrusts and 'mountain climbers'.  For these more advanced moves, she does have Anita show modifications.  The abs workouts are nothing new (crunches, reverse curls, leg lifts, bicycles, etc) but are all effective and well-demonstrated.WHO CAN DO THIS DVD:  Level 1 is actually what I would consider an Intermediate level workout.  Beginners can do it as long as they use no or light weights to start, and as long as anyone with bad knees or backs modifies the cardio to be low impact.  Level 2 is solidly Intermediate - a tough, intense workout that is not for beginners.  Level 3 is Advanced, though an intermediate level exerciser could do it if they follow Anita's modifications.  A very advanced exerciser may want to do level 2 and level 3 back to back.  As far as coordination levels, all the moves are basic and well-explained.... nothing fancy here and anyone should be able to follow this.  If you're looking for something dancy - look elsewhere.BOTTOM LINE:  Three well-put together and intense workouts, very well instructed and demonstrated.  Something for almost anyone - unless you are brand new to exercising.
summary: Review from a PT - FANTASTIC workout!

reviewText: Ever since my son was born (18 months ago), I haven't been working out at all. I lost all my baby weight, but I felt like my muscles were totally out of shape, especially my abs. I also felt like I needed more energy to keep up with my very active toddler. I had worked out with DVDs at home before, so I wanted to get something to whip me back in shape. After some research, I decided to try the 30 Day Shred. It seemed to offer exactly what I needed - an intense workout in a short period of time. I can easily do this workout while my toddler is napping, and still have time to do other things while he sleeps. At the same time, I feel like I really worked out hard. In the beginning, I had to take lots of breaks, even though Jillian tells you to keep going. Since I haven't worked out in such a long time, I wanted to give my body a chance to adjust. The more you do the workout, the less breaks you will have to take. Just listen to your body and do as much as you can, but keep pushing yourself.Here are some pros and cons:Pros:- Short (about 25 min. total) but intense workout that can fit in even the busiest schedule- I like Jillian's no-nonsense instructions. She gets straight to the point.- Modifications to each exercise are given for beginners.- The circuit style workout really maximizes the calorie burn.Cons:- The music isn't much to brag about. However, I'm so focused on the workout anyway, I didn't even pay much attention to the music.- This workout is hard on the knees and ankles, so watch your form while exercising.Some advice:- For the ladies: Wear a really good bra, for there is a lot of jumping involved.- For that same reason, wear good gym shoes that support your ankles. My feet were killing me the first time I did this workout. My ankles were on fire.For variety, I'm going to try Jillian's "No more trouble zones" DVD next.

reviewText: I purchased all three workouts and I'm on week one in level two. I have tried many different workout dvd's in my day. I'm always looking for fun, effective and challenging ways to work out. I have found it with this dvd series. You will be sweating, grunting, and dam near dying unless you are in top physical shape and even Jillian's super healthy "helpers" struggled at times. I really love it and I've been consistent and so far I've seen some real results. For example I'm up to twenty(quality)push-ups without stopping when I started at about eight. I can go through about half of the workout now without stopping or being completely winded. I haven't noticed a ton of change in my physical appearance but I've got a lot of weight to lose so I'm not sweating that too much right now. My clothes are without a doubt looser so I know I've lost inches.I'm not giving this video five stars only because I find the warm-ups and cool downs to short and not very effective. I warm up on my own and with Jillian and I cool down with Jillian and I head straight into my yoga routine. I've felt sore in some spots but if your waking up the next day aching (like it hurts to move and your in serious pain) your either pushing to hard or you need to add your own warm-up and cool-down. Also, this video series is incredibly hard on the knee's so when we are doing serious impact moves I stick with the beginner because IT'S SAFER. I'm still getting a work out but I'm protecting my knees and I feel no shame! I've been doing the video everyday but I alternate between one and two so I'm not working the same muscle groups day after day. I don't do the video's on the weekend but I workout in other ways.If your doing this workout but your not reining your eating habits you will not see results. You've got to lower your calorie intake and cut out the fast-food, sweets, and really watch your portion control even with "good" foods. It won't matter if your eating "right" if your still taking in more calories than you burn!

reviewText: I got this DVD several months ago and did level one.  I put it aside and never touched it again.  The reason is that I viewed it as unhealthy and unnecessarily high impact for a middle aged person, which is what I am.  I'm in decent shape, but I've slacked off this past year.  I've been doing workout tapes off and on for decades.  So I should've been able to tough out level one, right?  Wrong.However, this is the start of a new year, so I'm putting this DVD in the workout tapes lineup to give it another try.  The next time, despite Michaels' repeated instructions not to modify, I will heavily modify.  First, one thing she does is go from floor work in a prone position quickly back to standing-up cardio work, then quickly down to the floor in a prone position, then quickly back up to standing cardio work.  That got me very dizzy.  There was no time for my equilibrium to catch up.  I toughed it out, determined to get through that, but when it got to the point that I thought I'd faint or upchuck, I stopped.Next...the jumping jacks.  She says not to modify, but that is a must for me.  I don't have any particular knee problems.  One reason for that, I believe, is...I don't do repeated high impact movements.  It's unnecessary to do high impact to get healthy and in shape, and it is likely to damage the already worn joints of this middle aged person.  So I will modify that. (Also, I'm a tad buxom, and I find high impact somewhat painful and uncomfortable because of my busom, despite all the sports bras I've tried.  But maybe I haven't tried the right one?)All the rave reviews of the Michaels' workout DVDs are warranted, for those people.  But I wanted to share my review from the perspective of someone who may not be the average Michaels' customer.  Still, I'm going to give this DVD another try, with modifications, and update my review.  For now, though, I'm thinking that if a workout tape needs lots of modifications in order to do it, then that's not the right workout for that person (me).  It's for a younger crowd (and truth is, if I had a young daughter, I'd advise her not to do high impact; she'll pay for it later...ask Jane Fonda who has had a hip replacement and I think knee replacements).
summary: Be careful, and modify, modify, modify

reviewText: After working out with a variety of Biggest Loser DVDs for several months, I finally picked up one of Jillian Michael's solo projects, the 30 Day Shred. This DVD includes 3 levels of difficulty, meant to be worked up to over 30 days (presumably spending 10 days in a row on each level). Once you've hit the 30 days, or whatever schedule you work out for yourself, I recommend rotating all 3 levels for a nice variety.To summarize, this DVD is fantastic. Jillian employs a unique 3-2-1 circuit training system - three minutes of strength training (divided into two 30 second / 1:30 intervals), two minutes of cardio (divided into two 30 second repeating intervals), and one minute of abs, which you do three times with different moves in each circuit. Jillian has two 'helpers' working out behind her - one who generally does an easier, modified version of a move, the other who does a more hardcore move to work your way up to.Level 1 is a nice light workout that will still get your heart going, but without killing you - a great intro to the system and as Jillian promises, it does get easier with time, helping you to build up confidence in your body. Level 2 is by far the hardest of the 3 levels, with a large focus on the arms / shoulders / plank pose. Level 3, although challenging in its own way with many plyometric / jump training moves, also has some really creative moves I haven't seen in the other workout DVDs I've used, which actually makes it more fun than level 2.Jillian herself is, as always, a great motivational force. She doesn't talk too much, her instruction is very intuitive to make sure you don't strain your muscles or perform something incorrectly, and she seems to know exactly when you want to quit. Her 'bodies' in the back are a little less inspiring, angling more towards the robotic end of things, but they thankfully show good form, and also a little humanity when they get as tuckered out as you do (PS - keep an eye on Natalie, she cops out on a few moves, which Jillian occasionally calls her out on...you know it's a tough workout!).And most importantly - the results. This was a game changing DVD for me. I believe all of the working out I'd done leading up to this DVD was the perfect foundation for finally getting results. I've noticed my muscles firming up, my body slimming down, and generally just felt healthier and stronger, and very happy with how I've progress in general. I don't do all the tough moves all the time (or in a few cases, ever), and I should probably do Level 2 a bit more often, but I still feel great and happy I tried this DVD out, I definitely want to check out other Jillian Michaels products.A couple of caveats for everyone out there - I feel like this DVD would be extremely challenging for someone who hasn't been working out on a relatively consistent basis. Having done five months of Biggest Loser DVDs, I was used to the types of moves explored here - lots of squats, lunges, planks, etc. Don't be afraid to slow down the pacing of this DVD - work your way up in longer than 30 days, I myself spent two weeks on each level instead of just 10 days. Additionally I think if you're on the older side, this DVD would be quite challenging, as I tried to get my mom to do a Level 3 jumping lunges move and she nearly fell over. Finally, I wouldn't recommend anything heavier than a 3 lb or 5 lb weight, unless you're going for a bodybuilder look. As it is, I mostly stick to the 3 lb as I find many of Jillian's moves are pretty explosive and can strain your muscles with a 5 lb weight. That's not to say it's not worth challenging yourself - but be aware that this DVD is not for the ambivalent towards getting fit!

reviewText: I just finished 60 days of the 30 Day Shred.  I did level 1 for 10 days, level 2 for 20, and then level 3 for 30 days.  After the first 30 days, I hadn't really lost any weight, but I was noticeably more toned, my clothes fit better, and I felt better about myself.  After the next 30 days, I was even more toned and had lost about 5-7 lbs.Pros:- It works.  I'd been doing the Firm videos for several months, and wanted something more effective.  Although I haven't reached my weight loss goal yet, I can see my cheekbones and clavicles again, my glutes are more toned, my thighs look and feel great (and the ugly lines on the outer thighs are gone!)- It is fast.  I have very limited time in the morning, what with having to get my son to school.  25 minutes fits in perfectly.  Even though she keeps saying it is a 20 minute workout, and there are 3 circuits of 3-2-1 minute exercises, each level actually takes about 24-25 minutes with the warmup, cooldown, and transitions added in.Cons:- It's boring.  30 days of Level 3 was extremely boring.  I know some people mix up the levels, but I wanted to do each one individually for a certain time period.  Now I will probably mix them up.- Some of the exercises, especially in level 2, were somewhat hard for me to understand how to do correctly, so I didn't feel like I was getting the proper workout with them.Other tips and info:- I rented this on Netflix first, and after one session, I ordered it from Amazon.- I wasn't sure how regularly to do this, and other people have asked the same question.  The first 30 days I did 5 days on, 1 day off.  The second 30 days I did 5 days on, 2 days (the weekend) off.  At the end of level 2, she does say "See you tomorrow" so I think she expects you to do it without too many days off.- I had 3 sets of hand weights for level 1 (3 lb, 5 lb, and 8 lb), 2 sets for level 2 (3 lb and 5 lb) and 1 set of level 3 (5 lb)- Many people complain about the ads in the beginning.  If your DVD player has a memory feature, pause/stop it at the beginning of the workout and it should start right there next time you turn it on.  At the end of each workout, I go back to the menu, select the level I want, and then fast forward to section 2 (the beginning of the warmup).  Next day, it starts right there, no waiting.

reviewText: *Update 11/18/09  - So far I lost 7 lbs. with this DVD and cross-training with dance, pilates, and biking. I never did this for 30 consecutive days since I am already active and had 'special' days when jumping up and down proved problematic. I will leave this on rotation until next week when I'll need to shake things up for Thanksgiving! Good luck to everyone during the cold months ahead - we can do it!I received my DVD yesterday and usually hold back comments for at least a month. I workout on a really basis but I still have a few extra pounds to burn. I like the no non-sense attitude of Jillian when I'm trying to squeeze in a quick workout before my other duties in the morning. As a dancer, there are times when I like frilly but not so-much when I'm strength training. Back to the DVD...From all the other reviews you know that the exercises are basic. The key is that you are concentrating on your form and 'lingering' for a couple seconds with each move. By the end of the 1st segment which includes bicycle abs in slow motion, I was screaming 'Uncle!' But Jillian motivates you to 'keep at it and that we're not going to get body results for free.' Hearing that inspired me to realize that my burning quads would be just fine later, and they are! I'm in no pain today so I'm ready for round two! No breaks - the title says '30 Days!'As Dixie J. commented a few hours ago, nutrition information is not provided in this DVD. There is a website listed for a free starter kit but as Dixie said, you have to order that online for a trial period. I rated the DVD 4 stars (which is still great) because it states on the cover that you can 'lose up to 20 pounds in 30 days' which must be done with proper nutrition. Tamilee Webb provides nutrition information in her DVD menu or in a booklet that comes with the DVD. Why didn't '30 Day Shred' provide that from the start? We already bought the DVD.A few math items - there are 3500 calories in a pound. Depending on level of intensity, the average person may burn 8 calories per minute. If that applies to this workout alone that lasts for about 22 minutes, that's burning an average of 176 calories total (again depending on weight and intensity level).Those weighing more can burn more calories per minute which is why it is sometimes so difficult to lose those last few nagging pounds, especially if the workouts plateau. Back to the long-winded math which I'll direct at myself since I said I would do this for 30 days and report back to everyone. If I burn an average of 180 calories per '30 Day Shred' workout, working out for 30 straight days to this would burn about 5400 calories (or using the 3500 calories per pound formula, not quite 2 pounds).That's why nutrition information is so important too. Exercise is necessary, but what and how much we eat is even more important. Burning fat also means not providing too much fat in the first place. It was a hard decision to make, but I feel so much better eating a proper diet even though I still have to have a piece of pure chocolate every now and then.With today's economy, I'm glad that there are state health/weight loss programs (even competitions) you can track online and Dr. Ian from the 50 million pound challenge that offer FREE tools for tracking your progress and gives FREE meal plans and shopping lists for those foods. Check with your state to see what's offered or google Dr. Ian Smith.As a previous winner of a state-wide weight loss competition, I suggest that everyone take a good inventory of their refrigerators and pantries. Decide, like me, what's more important - your overall health or that 'high fructose corn syrup?'This has been my longest review ever, but obviously overall health is very important to me.  I'll write back in 30 days and record what happened. I'm sure someone else already did that, but we're all are trying to get there together and should contribute. See ya in 30!
summary: lost about 7 lbs with this & cross-training (former state weight loss winner)

reviewText: Whether a beginner, or advanced fitness buff, you are sure to enjoy this workout. Do the same workout with the "beginner" trainer.Jillian leads both.The workout is fast-paced but packed so you get maximum intensity in a smaller amount of time. Yes, you'll feel it...but it's simple to do and her constant motivation and "trainer talk" is truly like having a super trainer you'd pay hundreds of dollars an hour for...motivating you in your own home.My better half and I, both of varying levels of fitness, both LOVE this cd and are seeing superb results in little time. Because I have a heart rate monitor I can report I get a better workout with this cd than on my $2,000 elliptical machine...and a better workout than at Curves with faster results as well as far as the definition I've built.I've had a personal trainer before...but had nowhere near these results...its the motivation and the combination of moves combined with a true professional and extremely GOOD trainer showing you how and keeping you going. In fact, that's why I'm back on Amazon...to see what other cds she has. It's really improved our workout routine yet it doesn't FEEL hard when doing it...(although my heart rate goes up HIGH and I have great caloric burn)the next day you FEEL your muscle building...the soreness...and THAT muscle building is what keeps burning the calories and increases your metabolism while you lose inches.love it!p.s. the first time you do it...it may feel tough...hang in there, it gets easier each time then you can move up to the next level as your body gains strength and you get smaller!

reviewText: I'm no stranger to exercise -- work out every day for at least 45 min, and usually more. My main forms of exercise are swimming, the usual cardio machines (treadmill, elliptical, stair stepper, rower, etc.) and weights. So I was expecting to cruise through this workout without much trouble.Wrong!! The 30-Day Shred gives you a very thorough workout -- I was quite sore the day after my first use of the routines. Got the heart rate up and sustained, good mix of cardio and strength, and all done with straightforward routines.The programs are well done -- a bit chatty, but once you learn the routines you can kill the sound. Fast paced, so you may want to just watch it once from start to finish to get an idea of what's in store before actually starting. Good instructions throughout, as well as tips to ensure you are maintaining proper form to maximize results and avoid injury.I'm not looking to lose weight, but I have no doubt that sticking with this, coupled with a heathy diet, will very much aid those looking to lose a bit. Granted, any exercise plus a good, balanced diet will do the trick -- there's no magic to achieve fitness -- but this DVD is an entertaining and engaging way to get moving!

reviewText: This Jillian Michaels DVD offers three levels of intense, 20-minute workouts that are beautiful in their efficiency.  Based on her 3-2-1 philosophy, she leads you through 3 minutes of strength, 2 minutes of cardio, and 1 minute of abs for 3 sets, with a warm-up and cool down segment.  But what's great about it is that you work your arms while you work your legs, making that 9 minutes of strength-training as efficient as 18 minutes of more isolated lifting.  Because the warm-up begins to elevate your heart rate even before you begin the first set of strength training and because you don't take any breaks throughout, the 20 minute work-out ensures that you get sustained aerobics benefits for the duration.  You will need a set of hand weights, or multiple sets if you plan to increase the weights as you progress.Michael is great at giving you the extra burst of determination when you most need it.  She'll tell you that you have only 30 seconds of strength exercises left or that she knows you want to give up or that you don't get good abs "for free."  Her manner is somewhat gruff, but boy, does it work.  Who would have thought that a video would keep you on track, that it would make you feel as though you HAD to continue?  This part is perhaps even more valuable that the efficient, high-intensity workout.  The only downside is that you cannot skip the introduction, so you have to listen to Jillian Michael's workout philosophy and plan every time.Michael's recommends that everyone start with Level 1 -- and there's a reason for that.  Keeping up that kind of intensity, even for someone who is in shape, is not easy, especially during the strength training which uses multiple muscle groups at once.  I play tennis several times a week, so I'm in relatively good shape, but the Level 1 workout had me sweating five minutes in.For those who don't like dance-style or coordination-heavy aerobics, this DVD may be especially welcome.  You don't need to figure out any special moves since each exercise is straightforward.  You don't need to be coordinated beyond being able to do a jumping jack, although more coordination is needed for the higher levels.This workout got results, fast.  Even at Level 1, I felt the difference in just five days.-- Debbie Lee Wesselmann
summary: A workout that get results in half the time (5- stars)

reviewText: I found these workout tough! But that's what I wanted!  I need something to kick me into shape and this is it!!  I think I'm in great shape and went straight to Level 3 but that killed me and I had to go back to Level 2 the next time!!  Awesome awesome!!  I love Jillian!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This DVD, including its three levels, kicks butt, especially for beginners/intermediate exercisers.  Jillian Michael's 20 mins segments make you collect a pool of sweat and motivate you for more  BUT, I really think this is a great DVD for the 30 days only (unless you have not worked out in a while).  I have used this video to get back into a workout routine when I have been out of the routine for a while.  It puts me back into the playing field and prepares me for tougher workouts (like JM's own Burn Fat Boost Metabolism, or Bob Harpers Inside Out Method videos).If you are standing on the fense of buying this DVD, all I can say is: go for it!! It is great, it will make you feel like you cant even walk for the next several days when you first start it, and it gives you all the motivation to continue with your fitness goals.  There was no better feeling for me than to do this 20 min workout as soon as I woke up and be energized for the rest of the day.I have, and will continue to, suggest this DVD to anyone I know who is interested in getting in shape.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Jillian pushes you to the max and you will see results, no doubt about it!  I have been doing this for 3 weeks now, and I've seen some significant results!  The best part about this workout is that it's only 20 minutes long...I will push myself to keep it to only 20 minutes, and that's what keeps me going through this non-stop DVD!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Good fast, efficient workouts.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This is a great workout.Jillian does a great job with explaining moves and why she is combining moves.I like how she says not to look for a modification on jumping jacks. It makes me chuckle every time.I work out about 5-6 days a week.  I have not tried to do this work out for 30 days straight.  I do this workout about 2-3 times a day and I feel stronger and can make it through level one without feeling like I am going to die now.I think that next week I will try to move on to level two.The background music is very boring and not motivating, but Jillian's cues are on spot most of the time.  She is encouraging, but not annoying.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I thought I was in pretty good shape... at least, in good enough shape to finish this deceptively simple 20 minute workout.  Ha!  As if!The key to the 30 Day Shred isn't in the moves, but in the duration.  From the warm up to the cool down, there is NO stopping.  By the time I got to the end, my abs were aching and my legs were jelly.  But don't let that deter you from giving it a go.  Even the most devout couch potato will get the hang of it after a week or two.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

I've been taking classes at my gym, and am in pretty good shape.  I've done the Ripped in 30 before so I had a realistic expectation.Even though I'm in decent shape, this still delivered a tough 20 minute workout.  I definitely broke a sweat and felt like I'd worked out.  I am totally glad I bought this.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This workout is intense! Yesterday, when completing the last strength interval on level two I was literally in tears. This workout is no joke, but you WILL see results if you stick with it. I have. I also like, very much, the fact that Jillian is not overly perky- she's very no-nonsense.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I originally decided to try this workout because i had plateaued with my gym routine of jogging and weights.The added strength, cardio, and abs moves really switched it up good. within 3 week of doing the dvd almost every day i had lost 3 inches in my waist.The only thing i would recommend to anyone who does this dvd is added some extra warm up and cool down stretches in the beginning and end.  I do have tendinitis in 1 of my knees pretty bad and only doing a minute of stretching left me stiff and a little sore.  when i added some extra stretching on my own i felt alot better after.Overall i;m very pleased with this dvd and find the workouts very intense, which is what i like. if you don;t like intense workouts you will no like this dvd.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This is the BEST exercise video I've EVER done. I lost 18 pounds and toned up my legs losing 2.5 inches off each from doing the routine I've written below over 6 weeks! (but don't forget to add in a healthy eating plan too!)There are 3 levels. If you are looking to lose serious weight or just to switch up your current exercise routine, check out what I've found from experience WORKS to your advantage! Start with level 1 for 1 week, 5 times/week. Even if you're experienced with working out you should start here. If you don't usually do interval training this will get your body use to it for level 2. Then move on to level 2 for 1 week, 5x a week. Do level 3 for 1 week, 5x a week. Then switch back to level 2 for 1 week, 5x a week.  NOW HERE'S WHERE YOU'LL SEE EXTREME RESULTS::::: After the 4 weeks, do levels 1 & 2 back to back for about an hour long workout 3x/week and level 3 + 1/2hr cardio of choice right after 3x/week (do levels 1&2, the next day do level 3+cardio, next day levels 1&2 etc). I know, if you've ever done this dvd before your mouth is dropped, but trust me, you'll see major results in just 1 week from this!!! Do this (I call it double up workout) routine for 2 weeks. Jillian is tough, but she pushes you and doesn't waste your time, her dvd will transform your body. For women out there, you'll see even more incredible results doing a low carb diet with it and will help keep the weight off later. Just cut out things like bread for a sandwich and white potatoes at dinner, you'd be surprised how much this helps drop the pounds!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Seriously, I lost five pounds in the first six days of Jillian Michaels "30 Day Shred" DVD. My husband is already shifting his fat to muscle - I can see the difference. Jillian says to do the best you can and we have only tried Level One which is 20 minutes. We were dying the first 2 days during the workout and were sore and very tired afterwards but always felt good the next day so we did it again. My thighs feel different and I can get my zippers up easier. When Jillian says that 400 pound people can do the workout we couldn't possibly quit! We intend to continue all 30 days because we know we can.  We need to lose the weight and get into shape!  We are tired of being overweight, out-of-shape senior citizens!  What a motivating trainer she is! Highly recommended.
summary: AARP member!  I have lost 5 pounds in 6 days with this DVD!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I am probably an intermediate level of fitness.  I got a good workout from the video but I just don't find Jillian all that likable to watch again and again.  Much prefer Jackie Warner.
summary: good workout, not keen on instructor
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I am an exercise fanatic and always try the latest videos and products. I work out 5-6 days per week doing cardio every day and strength 3-4 times per week. THIS DVD WORKS! And let me prove it to you...Last week I was upset because I looked at the scale after a week of working out a lot and had not lost weight. I weighed in at 139.6lbs! Then, I found Jillian Michael's 30 day shred and after doing level 1 on day 1 and level 2 on day 3, I lost 2 lbs!!! This is incredible! I hope to continue this and lose another 2 lbs by next Saturday! This time flys by on this workout and I really feel that Jillian is there pushing me a long to my weight loss goals. Buy this DVD and you won't regret it!!!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Llevo aproximadamente haciendo ejercicios con los dvd's de Jillian por 3 meses, y me atreveria a decir que al mes comprobe los resultados!. Correr en el treadmill me bajo de peso pero necesitaba ponerme "tone" y reducir barriga, entre otras cosas......Llevo 3 meses y tengo ya dibujado sixpack que me atrevi a mostrarlo en mi ultimo viaje a Miami, aun hay grasa por eliminar pero el sixpack esta visiblemente ahi!!! mis brazos, gluteos, caderas, todo se ve mejor y con porte mas atletico. Sus ejercicios son en si por solo 20 minutos, adicionales de 3 minutos de calentamiento y otros 2 quiza para enfriamiento, debo confesar que yo termino con un dvd y comienzo con otro de ella, entonces hago 2 rutinas (55 minutos aprox) 5 o 6 veces a la semana, quiza este pecando de "overtraining" pero los resultados son notables y me motivan a continuar mas! Buena Suerte!
summary: Si pudiera darle mas de 5 estrellas lo haria!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I understand the fact that the trainer thinks if you only work for 20 min, it should be a difficult workout, but not sure if all the excercises she does are safe.  What hit me wrong right off the bat is that she encourages (actually doesnt give an alternative) jumping jacks.  I'm no expert, but jumping jacks are NOT good for everyone.  They can be very bad for hips and knees.  Generally, the dvd is ok.  Definitely not for the beginner though.  I work out 5 times a week and the beginner session was a little hard for me at first.  If you are intermediate and short on time, I believe this is a good dvd for you.  Not good for beginners though.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I am a personal trainer with an Exercise Physiology degree.  This was extremely informative and has helped me to fine-tune what I recommend to my clients.  Recommended if you want to continue to fine-tune your exercise program.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Jillian Michaels is amazing! She makes the DVD simple but yet gives you results. The workouts seem easy but they are super hard. For only 20 minutes a day you cant complain. You will see results!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I'm 52 years old, post-menopause and somewhat fit for my age; just getting flabby and losing muscle tone and gaining those extra inches around the tummy and waist.  I started 30 day shred 3 weeks ago.  I must admit; I haven't been really faithful to it as I should. I stayed on week one for 2 weeks just because it was so intense.  I couldn't get through the crawl push ups; killer.  Now I am doing week 2 and guess what?  Amazing things are happening!  I wake up in the morning with a zing! Not a struggle to sit up and get out of bed.  Running up a flight of stairs at the school I work at is much easier. I actually have more energy than the kids! What's more, I can already see a difference in my bod.  My chest and back feel more toned and my abs have an itty bitty 2 pack.  Yes!  This is a killer work out but it's only 30 minutes; perfect for those crunched for time. I love it because I don't have to pack up and go to the gym or fight traffic and stress out driving somewhere. Jillian is right there in my living room with me, kicking my butt and whipping me into shape. Let me tell you: this work out will NOT work if you don't push "PLAY" and get up out of your chair and do the exercises.  You have to move and "bring it"!  I am very pleased with my results so far and can't wait to get to week 3.  Love you hate you Jillian!!!!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Just did my first day on Level One.  Awesome.  Simple, back to basic moves.  Reminds you of high school PE type exercise, except that Jillian combines the strength, cardio, and abs in a series of circuit moves for maximum effectiveness.This is the best 26 minutes you'll get.  By doing her exercises efficiently, you really begin to understand how duped you are by all the fitness gurus out there and these fad celebrity diets.What I love about Jillian on the show and in her videos is that she 100% consistent.  Her personality and methodology is the same all the way through.As you're doing the exercise she points out wrong ways to do exercises that can hurt you and the right way to do things.  Her two models show an advanced version of the move and the beginner version of the move.  I did the beginner version and didn't realize how out of shape I really was.But I can definitely feel it's effects as I'm writing this.Jillian says you don't get great abs for free.  She's no nonsense, common sense.  None of that "find your feel-good place spirituality" nonsense.  Just plain exercise.  Great for both men and women.If you're ready to get back into shape with earnest exercise that works and you have 30 minutes amount of time, this is the video to do it with.  You won't feel obligated to workout and waste an hour on the tread mill.  You'll feel good and want to do this consistently.
summary: Awesome.  Back to basics With maximization.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I have a vast collection of fitness DVD's I don't utilize as much as I should (call it simple "laziness" on my part), so initially when I noticed this DVD had come to market I really had no intention of buying it, largely due to the unused DVD's I already own as well as the mixed reviews Jillian's other DVD's had received.  After reading a couple of weeks worth of reviews, though, and reading the positive impact people felt it was having on them I decided to pony up.  I am by no means a large/obese person but out of shape with about twenty to thirty pounds to lose and really figured I could use the motivation.  As I've always been a big fan of "The Biggest Loser" on t.v. and know how hard-core Jillian can be when it comes to whipping people into shape I thought I should give it a try.  I mean, if 300-pound people can handle it, I would hope I could, too.Thus, I am sitting here having just finished level one circuit and have to admit I am very impressed.  I wasn't sure how I would feel about things like push-ups and jumping jacks, but have to say it wasn't nearly as bad as I thought it would be, particularly given that she dishes them out in very brief intervals.  As I've been in "lazy" mode and have only been doing 40-minute elliptical workouts over the past few months (i.e. nothing challenging with weights, as I know I should be), it will be interesting to see how my body feels when I wake up tomorrow.So, I am looking forward to doing this DVD several times a week along with continuing my delightful elliptical workouts, and am hoping that this will help propel me to "Loser" status in no time (okay, if not within the 30-days I'm hoping at least sometime shortly thereafter).  Thanks Jillian, and thanks to all of the other reviewers for sharing their stories and making me a believer!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I just completed my month-long fitness challenge utilizing this dvd along with Jillian's Yoga Meltdown (3 days Shred, 3 days Yoga).  I did level 1 for two weeks and then levels 2 and 3, one week each.  I did not have to lose any weight, but I did want to tone up and get stronger.  I would say that this dvd helped my achieve my goals.  I could barely do a push-up when I started and was able to do all of the level 3 exercises by the time week 4 came along.  I am stronger, have much more definition in my arms and abs and have even toned up a bit in my thigh area (my trouble spot!)  The best thing about this dvd (along with Yoga Meltdown) is that there was no dread factor.  Jillian keeps you moving and motivated.  I like that the workouts are only 25 minutes.  I add on 20 minutes of rebounding or jogging when I get home from work, however, it is nice to start the day with a strong workout, no excuses.  We all have 25 minutes!!My favorite part of trying this dvd is the fact that I now enjoy exercising again.  I used to do Turbojam and the Firm workouts religiously and then switched to yoga.  Somewhere along the way I reached a bit of burn-out and only did a bit of yoga a few times a week.  Jillian helped me get back on track and now I look forward to the next challenge (I start Ripped in 30 tomorrow!).  Highly recommended.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This DVD has three workouts on it.  All three will push you hard.  After doing the first level for 4 weeks or so, I was able to continue on to the second level (but not in addition to the first, just do the 2nd on its own).  I have not reached the point where I can feel comfortable moving on to the third level.  My husband thinks the third level is easier than the second.  And I have a friend who does the second and then the third for her workout.  So, it can be versatile in that way.For sure, your heart is in your throat (as Jillian herself says) and you get really tired and sweaty.  I hate how exhausting the static holds or the high-bursts are.  I dread doing this workout for those moments.  I also really hate her dumb comments and given how little I like to be pushed this hard, I feel down right angry when she says things like, "Just think about jean shopping.  That's get me to work out for sure!" or something like that.Also, if you have any sort of joint problems, beware.  This video should be attempted by people who are in some sort of acceptable physical condition.  You do jumping jacks, lunges, and a few other high-impact movements.  I have stopped doing this video and given myself a few months rest from it when I hurt my knee.  This has happened a few times already.  I can run and rock climb, SCUBA dive, yoga, etc, but this high of high-impact is hard on my joints.  So, therefore, I say, proceed with caution.If I absolutely need to get the most out of a 20 minute workout, then this is my go-to DVD.  If I have more time to do something i enjoy a little more, I would rather do that.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: As always Jillian delivers. Sure, there's always "easy" parts, but you can always change it up.  You don't HAVE to do the exact same thing the actors are.  And like she says, "hit the up button! grab a heavier set of weights!"  A lot of truth to that.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: After day one, I was dying, but seeing the difference, that's for sure! The video is easy to follow and all you needs is hand weights and a little bit of room. I love that I only have to spend 20 mins on an awesome work out. I plan on buying more of Jillian Michael's DVDs when I get through this one!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I love this dvd. It is now an integral part of my exercise routine. She pushes you to do more. I would definitely recommend this dvid.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: If you stick to this and don't allow yourself to get discouraged I definitely believe you'll see results. Depending on your starting weight you might not be able to lose 20 pounds that quick, but you'll definitely feel better about becoming healthier and being someone that works out!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I was really apprehensive about this video.  Although the reviews are great, I was nervous that it would be way too intense for me.  Although I used other workout videos, I basically became sedimentary for a few months.  I always start a video with a lot of excitement, but they can never hold my attention.This video is different, though.  Not only did it hold my attention, it was completely doable - even for a person who hasn't gotten off the couch in months.  It's very tough and it definitely makes you sweat, but it's totally worth it.  It's the only video that I've wanted to get up and do during my rest day.  Jillian is very motivating in a non-annoying or evasive way.I wanted to quit so many times during the first and second time during this video, but I knew I just couldn't.  I kept telling myself that I only had to do 3 minutes (strength) or 2 minutes (cardio) or 1 minute (abs) and if I couldn't do 3,2 or 1 minute of working out, I never would.  Next thing I knew, I was finished and drenched in sweat.  Although she doesn't give a lot of time to rest or get water, in between each circuit, I found time to grab a bottle of water and take a drink.I know the workout is working because I not only have more endurance but my pants are looser and my shirts are hanging off of me more.  I never weighed myself before doing the workout, but I know I've lost inches.A lot of people are having trouble with the un-skipable beginning.  However, I left mine DVD in the player and it went right to the workout.  On my computer, it skips right to the workouts too.
summary: Anyone can do this and achieve great results
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Don't get me wrong, this video is great for getting results; but, the fact that it only contains 3 workouts makes it boring after a month or two.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I can tell by watching this that if you do it it will work. I can't say that I have tried it because I bought from Amazon Prime instant video and downloaded it to my desktop. So if you are thinking like me and want to make a copy for your portable DVD player, forget it. Buy the DVD. Now I have to pay for it twice, hopefully my mistake will save someone else some money. Information on the workout: It has 3 levels. I assume you do a level for 10 days and then progress to the next. Jillian doesn't do the whole video which some other reviews have pointed out. She does it long enough to demonstrate and then walks back to the 2 girls working out and talks about the modified version and makes sure they are doing the moves right. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I love this DVD.  Sometimes I get so tired of working out every single day, but it's not too hard to put this in, knowing it's gonna kick my butt, but it'll be over before 30 minutes is up.  I know it says it's a 20-minute workout, but it's got warm-up and cool-down, and a few itsy-bitsy breather breaks, so it ends up being ~26 minutes.  I'm always wiping sweat away before minute 10.  (And I'm in pretty decent shape already!)  There are 3 levels, and you can advance yourself as you feel the need to do so.  There's nothing saying you HAVE to do Level 1 for X days before going to Level 2.  I did Level 1 only 3-4 time before moving to Level 2.  I've been on Level 2 for nearly 2 weeks, and am just about ready to bump it up to Level 3.  This is a great workout, and I think it actually IS responsible for some of the inches I've been losing around my waist and hips.  Excellent!!!  Highly, highly recommend this workout.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I work out regularly (run outside, go to gym), but it's getting too cold to run, and I'm getting too busy to drive to the gym and back. So, I bought this! Level 1 made me sore the next day. I tried Levels 1 and 2 today (in preparation for Thanksgiving). I'm sure I'll be feeling this tomorrow, and that's the true sign of a good workout if you ask me!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I have owned this DVD for several years, but this year is the first time I gave it a serious try.  I have been doing it regularly for 3 months now and I am SO much stronger than when I started.  I started out doing Level 1 4 times a week for a month, then alternating Level 1 and Level 2 4 times a week, and now I alternate Levels 1, 2, and 3 4 times a week.  Each level does prepare you for the next one, but I feel like each one gives you such a different workout that it is a good idea to alternate them so you really work your muscles completely.  Honestly, though, they are challenging enough that I can't imagine doing one of these workouts every single day of the week- for me, 4 times a week is plenty!  I make time to warm up by walking for 15 minutes or so before each workout and I find that helps reduce soreness.  Now that I am up to being able to complete Level 3, I have taken some of the Level 3 modifications and I apply them to the easier workouts (holding weights to do punches, butt-kicks and jumping jacks, etc) and that way I am continuing to build more strength and challenge myself with each workout.I have lost about 3lbs since I started doing the workouts 3 months ago, but I wish I had taken measurements because my clothes are quite a bit looser from my muscles being tighter.  Even though I haven't lost much weight, everything looks smaller and tighter.  I am sure if I added a stricter diet along with this workout that I could really lose some pounds, but right now I am just focusing on the fitness aspect.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I have been cycling this workout for about a year among my other videos.  It is good if you want a quick 30 minute workout due to time constraints.  I consider the workouts are intermediate level with ways to increase or decrease the the intensity.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I've been needing a really good workout to do at home. The "30 Day Shred Season 1" is perfect for my needs. It doesn't take terribly long, and is definitely not boring. After I've finished the workout I feel like all my muscles have been worked and it gets my heart rate up as well.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I consider myself to be in pretty decent shape, but this dvd kicks my butt!I did Level 1 for about three days before I decided to move too fast and move on to Level 2.  Level 2 was so intense that I had to switch back to Level 1!  I don't even want to know what's on Level 3.I've been using 8 lb weights for this dvd, and I would say that those are pretty hard for me.  I would recommend 5-6 lb weights for starting the workouts.  I've noticed that with 8 lb weights I can't make it through some of the strength circuits without pausing a couple times.I combine this dvd with Jillian's Yoga Meltdown for that extra push, and I'm always drenched in sweat by the end of it!I recommend using this dvd on days off from the gym, or mixing it up with other Jillian and Biggest Loser dvds to avoid becoming bored.  After just 4 days of using it, I've definitely noticed a difference in my strength and endurance at my group gym classes.
summary: great workout for days off from the gym!!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This kicks my butt. After the first day I couldn't walk for a week! I recommend this because it's simple and easy, and it works.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I think this is a good workout if you are short on time and just want to get a little workout in.  I find Jillian to be much more personable in this video than she is on the Biggest Loser show.  The workout is 25 minutes from beginning to end, and it will get your heartrate up with the cardio, as well as work your muscles with the weights.  I would recommend.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This has to be one the most amazing workouts, I have ever done. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred
