reviewText: 30 days of Jillian Michael's 30-Day Shred later I'm reporting results.For the record, I did not follow any sort of diet or dieting rules and didn't go to her website. If I wanted something I pretty much ate or nibbled or shared it, including a small Blizzard and some boneless buffalo wings. Of course, on the flip side I often ate low-fat yogurt, oatmeal or Cheerios for supper or lunch. But that was because that's what I wanted at the time. Also, I didn't follow any other exercise program or add additional workouts to Shred. Any "success" is likely from doing Shred alone.Shred kicked my booty on several different levels. An exercise buddy and I committed to doing it all 30 days with each of the three levels lasting ten days. We just methodically did them and when it was time to move on, we did, whether we were afraid or ready or whatever.My buddy didn't do all the days so I'm just going to report my results. I lost 2 inches off my hips, 2 inches off my waist and an inch from my chest. Not only did the tape measure report that, I feel it in my clothes. Now. As I've discussed this with others and we laughed about Jillian's level 3 comment "You should be seeing that six-pack right about now." we've decided that under the "bubble wrap" I've got hanging around, that there is definite change and toning in those abdominal muscles. I can feel them move. My core is much stronger and the moves have gotten easier to do. Definition and strength clearly happened in my arms, legs and behind as well.Overall I lost 3.3 pounds. Not significant, but not awful either. I'm not trying to break weight loss speed records, just get in better shape and working on becoming healthier. So I'm very pleased with that for 30 days of 20 minute work-outs.Now. Here's the nitty gritty.I hated listening to Jillian's explanation every day. You can't cut to the chase, you have to go through her 2-3 minute intro. Annoying. Sometimes the comments got a little annoying as well. The visual was nice because the camera hit mostly full body and traveled from the high-intensity model to the lower-intensity model during each move while Jillian explained what was going on and why. I loved that Jillian explained why some exercises were Level 3 and how they worked the muscles, and what was being accomplished etc. The music was a little annoying, too, but I was able to ignore it most of the time. I would've liked to see some different cool-downs because the warm-ups were different for each level.Many of the exercises are high intensity and I felt a lot of them in my knees both during and after. Level 3 is really high intensity with plyometrics (explosive movements, i.e. jumping) like jump squats, rock stars, sumo squats, jumping jacks with weights, mountain climbers, jumping lunges. In the 10 days we did this level I was not able to do the entire session at the higher level intensity. My body got used to it and my knees aren't barking anymore but be warned. I had a shoulder that yelled at me the first few days I did Level 1 but it hasn't bothered me since. I really felt the squats and other intense moves in my rear-end. So much so that the only relief I got in Day 3 of Level 3 was to do Shred for the day. The ab workouts were mostly painful and did their job, covering every stinking muscle (according to my complaining abs anyway).I loved, loved, loved that this is an intense 20 minute workout and it's a keeper. I can always put in 20 minutes. No excuses. I am going to give Jillian's Banish Fat, Boost Metabolism DVD a shot. It's 40 minutes and I'd like to see the difference in results.
summary: Shredded A Few Spots But Good.

reviewText: I was skeptical. Get toned using a 30-min workout? Riiiight. I am thrilled to say Jillian proved me wrong! I'm on level 3 after 16 workouts (spaced out over a month so I can train for a marathon) and I can truly see a difference in my abs and arms. I am a Mommy of two who works out about 6 days a week. This is the first program that has made a significant difference in my appearance.Here's how it breaks down: The program is broken into 3 levels of approx. 30 minutes each. Each level features 3 circuits that include strength, 2 minutes of cardio, and 1 minute abs, plus a very short cool down at the end. In addition to the levels, the workouts feature women who model two different approaches to the moves. Natalie demonstrates the tougher moves, and Anita shows us the modified moves. (Jillian GUSHES about Natalie's appearance, and while she does look absolutely fantastic, Anita does, too!). The workout incorporates moves that require light hand weights and a padded surface (I use my yoga mat).Another reviewer stated that Jillian's approach is "old-school gym class," and I agree. She is tough but encouraging. When moves get hard, she reminds you to think of why you bought this workout in the first place - like  bikini shopping!I LOVE that this is a fast and effective workout - perfect for Mommies trying to get a workout in during naps.My ONLY criticism is that some of the tough moves ARE hard on knees. For instance, I don't do the jumping lunges in level 3, I stick with regular old lunges. I am a runner and I'm trying to be nice to my knees!THANK YOU, JILLIAN! Keep 'em coming!
summary: No Mommy-tuck for me thanks to Jillian (and some hard work)!

reviewText: Ill get down to the important stuff first. Just starting to say i had my second baby 10months ago and i needed some sort of weight loss boost!I didnt weigh myself, because i feel like when i do, i just tend to concentrate on a number.so i dont exactly know how much i lost. I did measure myself though and i lost:5inches around my hips2inches from my waistjust over 1inch around my arms.1inch around my thighs (although they look a lot smaller so im wondering if i measured wrong initially) , i also lost around my calves and upper body but i did not measure these.I've done jillian michaels work outs before, but ive never been able to stick to them, because ive felt so spent afterwards (not the good endorphin rush if that makes sense). So i was intrigued by the 30day aspect, and the- fact that it was a 20min workout -30 if you count warm up and cool down.I found Level 1 was already on youtube for free. So i decided to give it a go.My goal was to do the 30 days without a rest day. For extra motivation throughout the process, i kept looking for positive reviews online and on youtube (they really did help!).During the shred, i did end up catching a cold and get the usual aches and pains, but some days i did just push through and do the work out anyway. I think i stuck the rule of if you're ill from the neck up, its fine, but neck down, take a rest. In all i had about 6 rest days (not all at once, but here and tehre).I have to say, i really enjoyed the whole process. It spurred me on when i started seeing the results! I would say I could see a visual difference on the third day, but started seeing a measurement difference on about day 9 i think, although it could've been sooner.Eating wise, i did eat healthy, but i didnt deprive myself. So if i was in the mood for something sweet, id have a hot chocolate, or sometimes when i was in the mood id have a pastry! If i was out and my family were having fast food, id just have a medium fries instead of a whole meal, or i just would give it a miss!I did swaps too, so for me, instead of eating chocolate i found that medjool dates hit that sweet craving for me.(my major weakness and a personal choice to cut it out completely. Ive never found eating chocolate to make me gain weight. But I found that if i didnt eat it, i would get a headache, so i wanted that gone.)I still do swaps and im trying to make lifestyle changes, so i dont do "cheat days". I have a little bit of what i want when i want. But i dont exaggerate! This seems to be working for me, so im pleased!There is an eating plan to go with this, but i didnt find out about it till the last level of the shred, so i juts did my own eating plan. The eating plan is free online. I think it says ripped in 30, but it still applies to the 30day shred. It looks like a good eating plan too.I loved the first level, i found jillian to be supportive and encouraging, but in the second and thrid, i found her to be really irritating and cocky! lol. BUt that is just me. I saw a lot of reviewers say that the thrid level is killer, i actually found it to be more enjoyable than the second. I did not like level 2, but i think that is because im not keen on upper body moves.I've decided im going to start over doing the shred again, because i enjoyed the process so much! I'm very pleased with the results.I will add that around day 10 my knees did start to hurt, so instead of stopping, i just adjusted certain parts of the workout to accommodate, and then my the end of the second level, the pain had gone away. My thinking was that the joints are hurting because of lack of work out (for me anyway), so tehy're getting used to movement. I'm glad i persevered. I just tried to listen to my body and not push or punish my body.I always followed the beginner workouts and sometimes i would try and do the advanced.Now ive started doing a work out that is a bit different. It's called Ballet Beautiful, wich aims to give you longer, lean , toned look...which is what im aiming for. I'm doing the ballet beautiful 5days a week and doing the 30shred every other day.I'm so glad i did the 30day shred, it's kick started my weight loss and even though i still have a way to go, im so pleased with the results it gives for just 20mins a day.If you ever find yourself not wanting to do it, just tell yourself 20MINS A DAY! The only work outs you regret doing are the ones you dont do! Give yourself reasons to just do it, instead of excuses as to not!Level 1 i did on youtube for free and bought the other two levels on amazon! :)
summary: Great results in just a short workout time!

reviewText: Wow...ok so I read nearly EVERY review posted here and of course decided to try the video for myself...I just did it two days ago and my legs are more sore today than yesterday! The workout as others have said is a lot of squats, jumping jacks, push-ups, jumprope etc.  Nothing too hard choreography-wise just tiring! I recommend it for anyone looking to get in shape fast!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I have not tried this yet but my daughter says it is a good workout.  She said it can really wear you out!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Being a fan of Jillian's other workout DVDs (I own "Ripped in 30" & "6 Week Six-Pack") I thought this would be a good addition to the collection & I couldn't beat the price ($7 on amazon.ca).The DVD: It works great, no issues there. As always, it has an easy-to-use menu, which I know anyone who uses her DVDs appreciates this, especially when you want to get straight to your workout without any hassle.The Workouts: I love both all 3 levels, they get the blood flowing & heart rate going. Jillian has you work on different muscle groups than "Ripped in 30" & "6 Week Six-Pack" it's a nice change of pace. These are tough workouts but it's worth it. I love how positive Jillian is throughout the entire workout as well. I personally like to do Level 1, 2 or 3 from "30 Day Shred" & then one from "6 Week Six-Pack"; the two combined are amazing & sure to get results fast. These workouts will come in handy during the winter when it's dark, raining & snowing because Jillian has you do cardio & strength. In my opinion, I much prefer this to "Ripped in 30".Overall: Highly recommend for fans of Jillian & anyone looking to get toned fast. "30 Day Shred" & "6 Week Six-Pack" are my favorites!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I really like Jillian training techniques, she is straight forward and let you know that modifying exercise (from hard to easier) is not an option, if 300 lbs people on Biggest Looser can do it, anybody can. She has the know-how and gets the job done, loosing fat and strengthening bodies.I wish that someone would come up with a DVD that has different workouts for the whole week (every day), so it keeps it interesting, maybe with the blue ray technology it will be possible, the disk has more space.I recommend this DVD to all.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I have been working out for years, from weights, to running, to structured classes at the gyms and began working out at home over a year ago, to save time and money.  These workouts are 20 minutes long, making it an easy commitment, and if you are honestly working as hard as Jillian is telling you to, and following a sensible calorie controlled diet, these workouts are effective. The three levels of workouts, and 3 2 1 sequence of strength, cardio and abs keep the workout interesting and makes the time fly, I'm done before I know it.  The moves are challenging but there are opportunities to do the modified versions of many of the moves, if a person would need to.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This is a fantastic deal for three quick, effective workouts that get your heartrate up and work your whole body. The only thing I would like to see would be a little more thorough of a warmup and cooldown, but I can do that on my own. Her main thing is to get the workout part in. She might be annoying to some people at times, but I have done tons of workout videos and have never seen one that doesn't have a review criticizing the "annoying" instructor. So anyway, I think it is a great trio of workouts, and I mix them up over the course of the week with yoga, running, lifting weights in the gym, other workout videos, playing with my kids, housework, etc... They are a great deal and great for the time-pinched folks!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I've had this dvd for a long time now but avoided using it, mostly because it is INTENSE and because it hurts my knees. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I say go for this bc you get more in this since it's so old, it's really cheap now and you get more exercises too than the newer ones!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Solid workout in 30 minutes. I bought this dvd w/ little expectation but I was pulled in w/ the idea of being able to burn a decent amt of calories in only 30 min. These 3 workouts are great for days you don't have time or are just not that into working out, so that you are still killing calories. I rotate these smaller workouts w/ some of her extended dvds to keep it interesting and to work different body groups. I have been on a "Jillian" dvd rotation(30 min shred, metabolism boost, 6 week abs, advanced shred) for about a month and I feel great and I am super toned and feel strong. I can see definition in my body but I cant' really say that I have lost weight but I think that has more to do w/ my diet.  My only warning is that if you tend to build leg muscle and booty muscle quickly beware because w/ all the jumping and squats and burpies in her video circuits your legs and booty will be pumped up! So if you aren't looking for that just be cautious ;)
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I bought the 30 Day Shred a while back.  Last week I got it out because I am taking a trip and wanted to get rid of a little weight! Of course with just a month away I figured let's get the workout out.  How hard can it be?  Just 25 minutes right?  Boy, was I wrong.  I started it a week ago today, just one week ago.  I have lost 6lbs and 2 inches (yes, that is 2 inches) on my waist.  I still haven't moved up to level 2 even though I thought I was in decent shape aerobically.  Needless to say she kicks my butt!  I am sore and feel incredible.  On top of that you get 30 days free at her online site!  Her menu's rock and she really does give "sound" advice, hard work, but great!  If you want to feel good, get in shape and eat healthy, this is the trainer to look up!  Just be prepared this workout really works you out!!  Down 30lbs and 4 sizes after 3 months.  I am going to continue.  I love it and rotate with the Biggest Loser Cardio Max and The Firm Wave.  I also do Weight Watchers, no sense working out so hard if I am not watching what I eat or watching my portions!!  The two work great hand-in-hand.  Spend the few dollars, you will be thrilled you did!!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I just finished my first workout and I think... I think I might be dying lol I take this as a promising sign, since it's been quite a while since I've come across a vigorous enough workout to make me feel this awful :)  Admittedly, I did have to stop a couple of times for a quick break, but I stuck to what Jillian said and didn't take more than 5 sec. at a time.A little background on myself: I'm 23... I went of to college and gained what I call the "college 30". I didn't gain 15 as a fresh, but by the end of uni I'd gone from being 130 to 160. I then joined the work force, while continuing school to get grad school pre-reqs. My schedule makes no time for working out. I work from 8-8 each day, on top of school work and any other errands I have to run. I'm not comfortable with running outside in the dark, and I can't afford a gym. I've been trying to make due with the Wii Fit my parents gave me, but it just wasn't doing anything for me.I decided some months ago to get back into shape because I seemed to keep having to buy larger and larger pants sizes. Getting into exercising is tough for me, because I have severe asthma that is not well controlled, even on lots of medication. On a regular basis, I wheeze, and working out feels like someone is driving a knife through my chest. I was finally starting to get into a routine in June, when one day a lady ran a stop sign and broadsided my car, resulting in me sustaining a lower back injury. Lots of PT later, and I still suffer from occasional pain. It's very hard to find the will to work out when just sitting in a chair is painful.Lately I've been feeling better, so I wanted to try to get into working out again. I'm going on a trip to London, Paris, and Rome in May, and I really want to look amazing for it! Traveling doesn't seem like it'd be as much fun if I'm gasping for air from being out of shape the whole time! I'd heard this workout was amazing, so I'm having a go. I'll keep this review updated with my progress. Right now I'm 171.6 lbs (and I'm 5'6"). My goal is 140 by May 22. Here's hoping!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Because the workouts are only 20 minutes, and because they are easy to follow and very difficult - this has been the only workout video that I've been motivated enough to do regularly 3 times a week since purchasing it.  I just tried Workout #2 and I can tell that once I get to the third workout, I will be shredded physically... the moves are simple: jumping jacks, pushups, squats, planks, etc.. and those are the moves that are tried and true for getting your body into shape.  Others find Jillian annoying, but I think she is cute and good at motivating you to finish the last rep.  I finally can do ONE real push-up (no knees) and that is a landmark for me in my fitness!!  And I see real definition in my hamstrings - never have before!I don't know what the "30-day" part of the title means, because in no way would I master Workout 1 in 30-days let alone the whole DVD!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: this one always gets my heart pumping! I only do level one because two and three are pretty hard on my knees, and I would have to adjust some of the moves. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I like that this gets you results fast. Its tough, but if you expect to lose 20 lbs in 30 days - its going to be tough! The moves are perfect for both beginner and intermediate. I feel the burn by the end of the circuit! I like that there are different levels to the workout and I choose when I move up to the next work out. I like that it forces you to warm up and cool down. I do not like that you have to watch the entire intro everytime you want to work out. You should be able to skip through it to the menu.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This is a really good workout.  It's geared a little more to advanced exercisers, but the choreography is fairly basic and you will definately feel this the next day.There are three workouts that combine toning and aerobics together which are about a half an hour each.  This way, you're burning fat and toning muscles at the same time.  It's a little challenging, but fun and effective.  The first workout is the easiest of the three and from there it gets more challenging.  The most challenging workout is tough like she shows on The Biggest Loser (ie travelling pushups and tough jumps etc).  It's a good idea if you're intermediate to begin either at the start or middle and stick to that for a while and then move on.  Each workout uses toning, kickboxing and ab work.I found this really good to do.  It's absolutely a good idea to not go too quickly with it and begin at the lower of the three levels even if you do it only a couple of times - you can always advance as soon as you're ready for your next workout.  She may not be the best cuer, but she is certainly encouraging and motivating.  This is fun and I highly recommend it.  I've only done it twice so far since it's so new, but I can still feel my muscles thanking me.  This is great.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Rarely do I try a workout on DVD that is shorter than 45 minutes where I feel really challenged and like I am pushing it to the limit. JM always delivers! Yet another winner from the best I've found!!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Even if there were only level 1 on this DVD, it would be a great value. Level 1 is a great 25 minute video. (the "20 minute" refers to the length of time on the circuits, not including warm up and cool down/stretching). But the fact that there are two other intense and challenging workouts on this dvd makes it a fantastic value! I am a regular exerciser and in fairly good shape. After having done the level 1 workout a couple of times I am at the upper end of level 1 (except for the pushups) and plan to alternate levels 1 and 2 for variety and to transition up a level.This workout is great for people who find most traditional workout videos "okay, but not terribly challenging." it will help keep you from plateauing. I was thinking as I showered afterwards that the last time a shower felt this refreshing after a workout was when I used to do 1.5 hours of cardio at the gym -- but this was only 25 minutes!If you have knee problems, be forewarned: she does not modify some of the exercises (like jumping jacks.) Even though she says "I've seen 400 pound people do jumping jacks and you can too" if you actually have serious knee problems, you'll need to modify the moves yourself.Good luck!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I love this DVD. Jillian really beats you up, but that's the beauty of it - and she does so in a way that is motivational and informative. She does a great job discussing the "hows" and "whys" of her program, and she focuses a lot on proper form, which is really important if you want to avoid injuries. She isn't phony or overly perky - it's just a straight-up butt-kicking workout.I've been doing this workout to shed 20 pounds of excess baby weight, and I'm liking the results so far. Plus, you can't beat the fact that each workout is only 20 minutes long - even a busy mom can find time for that a few days a week!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: These workouts are great if you only have 20 minutes.  This video has three levels; beginner, intermediate, and advance.  The beginner is pretty tough and the intermediate and advanced are probably right on target. I like to work out for at least 40 minutes so I usually string two of these together.  These are tough workouts, the cardio gets your heart up and the stength training is solid.  The workouts do feel redundant with banish fat and no more trouble zones.  If you have those two workouts, you might want to skip this one. This is a similar circuit training workout.Jillians workouts are fun to do and do not require a tremendous amount of coordination which is a bonus for those of us who like to workout early in the morning (I'm a 5:30 exerciser so learning complicated dance routines is not for me). I like a workout I can jump in a do without needing a long learning curve. This is relatively simple to learn but difficult to do.
summary: Tough workouts when short on time
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This DVD works, if you are willing to put in the work. We are on day 6 of level 1 and my stomach although not perfect looks amazing! I'm honestly addicted. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: If I had to go to the gym, I'd never workout. So, I've tried a number of workout tapes over the years and for many I really DREAD doing the workout. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: From a perspective of: Getting a great workout in 20 min and making you sweat, this video will do just that. The moves aren't fancy, easy to follow and will get the heart rate pumping! Level 2 in my opinion is harder than level 3. The main complaint people have with workout videos is not getting board, and the motivation to do it. This video goes super fast, and you will get a great workout in 20 min. The complaints I have is that it has 3 levels, each 20 min, so if you are more advanced like me, I only get 40 min worth of exercise out of a 60 min video. Also the moves are hard on your joints. I personally like Angie Gorr's 50/50 cardio weights where she shows 3 levels all at the same time, so you get 70 min of pure level 3 if you want, or can mix and match between lower and higher levels during the exercise. I am also a fan of Jari love and Jackie Warner, which are in my favorites along with this video. Both Jackie and Jari focus on more high-repetitions. The 30 day shred video is more of a circuit, and doesn't completely fatigue the muscles like Angie,Jackie and Jari; however, it does keep the heart rate up while doing weights.  Jillian's style takes some getting used to, but the more you do the video the more she grows on you. This is definitely a video that you will use over and over again, but you shouldn't do it 30 days in a row. You want to give your muscles a rest, so if you are sore, then switch to a cardio video for a day, and then go back to this a day later. I've done over 50 workout videos, and this one is one of my favorites, but if you have injuries, just be careful and listen to your body and modify the exercise if you start to feel pain.
summary: Keeps you entertained and good workout, but hard on joints
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I am an intermediate to advanced exerciser; when I read the reviews that this DVD kicks b____, I was skeptical.  However, I was so disappointed with the latest Jari Love DVD, that I decided to try something different.  I would not say that level 1 is easy but at the level I am used to, it was not enough for a full workout so I decided to combine levels 1 and 2.  By the time I was finished with level 2, there was NO WAY I could go on to level 3.  This was a great workout. Jillian has a good steady voice and focuses on form.  She provides enough inspiration without sounding like a cheerleader.  I am eager to combine a 30 minute run/walk interval with either level 1 or 2, and at some point achieve Level 3. This a definite interval workout.  There are 3 circuits in each level.  3 minutes of strength, 2 minutes of cardio, and 1 minute of abs,  and then two more times--but, each circuit is different and each level is different.  The strength was challenging (although level 3 looks very difficult) but not as focused on weight training as Jari and I increased my weights accordingly. (There is no tricep work--mainly shoulder, bicep, chest and lower body.) By the end of level 2 cardio sessions,however, I welcomed the strength training.  I am excited to work this into my regular workout session. After it was over, I felt a great sense of accomplishment.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I had been working out for a while when I got this, and I thought it would be no big deal. As so many others have found, I WAS SO WRONG! This workout attempted to kill me numerous times. The workouts are excellent: fast, painful (in a good way), and well-rounded. I think Jillian does a great job explaining form, and she seems to know exactly when I want to give up because she always says something right at that time. Also, Jillian is NEVER fake or annoying (to me at least). I can't even watch some other DVD's because the instructors are so...gross, cloying, fake-encouraging. I feel like Jillian is someone I could actually hang with (if she would stop trying to KILL me :)). I've been through all the levels now (I've been doing the workouts for a few months). I can honestly say that my body has transformed as a result. I am so much stronger--toned and I can take a lot more cardio. I love this DVD!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: A couple years ago, I bought this out of desperation. I committed to doing level 1 every night for 30 days. Whenever I missed a day (which was NOT often) I tacked another onto the end of my schedule. I saw results fairly quickly -- like muscle tone, etc. But I didn't lose weight until week 4. Then I dropped 10 pounds. It was glorious. And I did level 1 the entire month! I work out in my bedroom, so I don't have enough space to do the others. Honestly, this was a wonderful program, and I'm eager to do it all over again soon.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I did this program exactly as directed and lost zero weight. Level One is perfect for someone massively out of shape because it gets easier every few days. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I had never purchased a Jillian Michaels DVD before b/c of the hit or miss reviews. So when I heard raves about this one, I decided to give it a shot and I am so glad I did. This is an absolute butt-kicker workout. I am an intermediate/advanced exerciser (I work out 5-6 days a week) so I figured I could see what Level 1 was all about and move onto Level 2 right away. Listen to me folks--these workouts are HARD. Level 2 was VERY difficult--a good difficult though, very challenging. When Jillian tells you to start at level 1, listen to her she knows what she's doing. I've been at this for about 5 days, and I already feel a difference in my body.Jillian is tough--absolutely NO rest in this workout (not even for a sip of water) but that's what makes it go by so quickly, and it makes your body change, according to Jillian. You're done before you know it--but by the end you've gotten a kick butt workout and feel like you've really done something. She bases her workout on the 3-2-1 method: 3 mins strength, 2 mins cardio, 1 min abs. Her strength circuits remind me of Jari Love--compound exercises that work the upper and lower body simultaneously. The cardio is good as well: a lot of jumping, so watch those knees (she has a modifier for beginner and lower impact) And the abs is straight up ab work--a variety of crunches and twists on the floor.This is a great workout and I find Jillian to be tough but she's pretty likeable. Be warned though: she's no-nonsense. I think it's funny when during the stretch she admits she's not flexible and struggles to reach her legs on the floor. I thought "Ha, Ha, finally something I'm better at than Jillian!" lolIf you really want to get a good workout and to jumpstart your weight loss get this DVD you will not be disappointed. It's great for those who are short on time too and want to try something new; every workout is just under 30 mins!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I'm really more of a runner, but I bought this video as a winter and rainy-day work out after my twins were born.  The video is only 20 minutes long, has 3 levels of difficulty (that are filmed separately, which is nice), and most importantly, WORKS.  My muscle tone improved significantly and I lost a few pounds just in the first 10 days.  I wasn't really heavy to begin with (just ten lbs of baby weight) and it worked great for me, so I imagine the results would be even more drastic for someone with more to lose.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Well, first off a brief explanation of the video itselt.  There are three levels: 1,2,3.  One is the easiest and each one gets harder.  They are said to be 20 minutes each, but when you add in her little bit of talking, warm-up and cool-down you are actually looking at about 27-28 minutes.  That was a bit of a let down for my time-crunch life, but no biggie.  You do 2 minutes of warm-up, then the work... 3 minutes of strength training (using dumbells), 2 minutes of cardio, and 1 minute of ab work.  Repeat that 3 times and add a 2 minute cool down.  That may not seem like it's going to be  much of a challenge, but trust me, after you do one level you will know it is tough!  One of the biggest differences I've noticed between this and a lot of other workout videos is that there is NO REST.  You better hope you don't need a drink or your shoelaces come untied because you barely have time to get into position before she gets you going.  I noticed some people have made Jillian sound like a really hard person, but believe me, she is not without heart.  Yes, she moves you along and takes no excuses, but she encourages you at the same time.  I, personally, like her style.  I don't want someone to baby me through a workout.  And I agree with a lot of the philosophy she spurns out as you are working.  I've been working out steadily for 7 years now, and trust me, she is right.  If you ain't panting and feeling some burn in your muscles, you ain't going to see much difference.Just so everyone knows, I'm not really doing this to lose weight.  My weight teeters between 110-115.  I workout to stay toned and healthy.  And also because my diet is not the best, so I need a little extra boost to help me maintain my weight.  This video has been a big help.  I've been doing it for about 2 weeks and I can feel myself getting stronger.  My abs actually look a little more defined too, and who doesn't want that?!It's nice to have 3 levels to choose from because some days... after work... I'm not really feeling like a level 3, but some days I can handle it.I have been combining this with other video, it's true because my body is used to working out for at least an hour each day.  I do everything from Taebo, to Pilates, to Yoga, to this.  Variety really is a key to keep from hitting plateaus and from getting bored.  Let's face it, if you are bored with a video or exercise routine, you aren't going to feel like doing it.  This video gives you 3 workouts to mix it up.  It's been a great addition to my collection.  Thank you Jillian.  I will be looking into more videos created by her.  I like her style!  Good luck to all.  I truly believe if your goal is to lose weight from doing this, it will help as long as you are watching what you eat too.
summary: Tough, but doable, Jillian is awesome!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Let me start by saying I am completely out of shape and not used to working out. I was sweating and out of breath by the end of the warm-up. I'm trying to build up my stamina to begin my "30 days" because this is one tough DVD. I do believe it will work if the effort is put into it. After my first level 1 workout, I was sore for several days so I know I was working all the right muscles. This is not for beginners, folks!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I like this workout for days when I only have time for a very short workout; however I definitely have WAY better workouts in my (large) collection.  I like Banish Fat, Boost Metabolism, or No More Trouble Zones way better. I  think the suggested rotation for this workout is to do it mostly every day until you feel you can progress??  What about not overusing muscle groups by working them back to back?  Most fitness professionals advise resting in between working the same muscle groups.  Level one is not challenging for me at all, so I tend to do only level 2 or 3.  (I consider myself low advanced, particulary with cardio, more advanced with strength.)  She uses very light weights throughout; I keep several sets nearby so I can switch as needed because using 3 pounds or 5 pounds for the duration just doesn't cut it for me.  I do like Jillian and find her to be pretty positive and encouraging.  This does have a place in my collection, it's just not one I reach for often.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I'll admit it: I hate exercising. It's boring and there always seems to be something better I could be doing with my time. However, as I get older, I find myself becoming more motivated to get healthy. The fact that I've gained a few extra pounds (well, more than a few) is another motivation. I have never watched "The Biggest Loser," but I heard great things about this Jillian Michaels DVD from several of my friends, so I decided to give it a try. I'm very glad I did.First of all, "30 Day Shred" is perfect for someone like me who just wants to get her workout over with as quickly as possible. Jillian's routines combine strength, cardio, and abs for a fast-paced workout that you can do in less than half an hour. (The main workout itself is only about 20 minutes long, and then there are a few minutes of warm up and cool down exercises.) The idea is to work multiple parts of your body at once and to go through the routines fast without stopping to catch your breath.The DVD contains three different levels of workouts. Level 1 wasn't super challenging, so I moved onto Level 2 after just a couple of days. I must tell you, Level 2 is kicking my you-know-what, so it will probably take a couple of weeks before I am brave enough to try Level 3. The workout is short, but I work up a sweat each time. And it's only about 20 minutes of exercising. You really can't beat that.Along with using this DVD, I also modified my eating habits. I'm not a believer in diets, but I did decide that eating everything that didn't move probably wasn't the best way to get myself in better shape. I cut out soda and removed all the alcohol and sweets from my house (sob!), but I haven't cut myself off from the foods I love entirely. My husband and I go out to dinner once a week and I order whatever I want to eat or drink, but I find that I'm not as hungry as I used to be and rarely finish everything on my plate. I'll still have a (small) piece of cake at a birthday party at work, but just one. It was hard at first (and it still is sometimes, especially since I work in the same building as a Hershey's store...yum!), but I'm getting there.Bottom line: this program is working. Between Jillian's workouts and my new eating habits, I lost almost five pounds in the first week! I'm anxious to see how I look and feel at the end of the 30 days. I'm also eager to try some of Jillian's other DVDs. If you're trying to get back into a regular workout routine, this is a great way to do it.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: About me: I am a 37-year old mother who had my two kids in my 30s. With the first one I developed hypothyroidism and so have trouble losing weight. I also have Diastasis Recti from my second baby and so can't do certain moves, like popping up from lying down on my back.I LOVE this video! I cried through it the first time I did it, but quickly mastered Level 1. I started the video a week before Thanksgiving and did it three times a week to alleviate some of the heavy Holiday foods I knew I'd be eating, and I can honestly say that even eating tons of fatty foods for the six week holiday season I did not gain a single ounce - just from doing this video three times a week on Level 1.Yes, it's difficult. And, because of my Diastasis Recti I can't fully do all of the ab exercises completely, but I simply do my best and do what I can. I cannot emphasize this enough: PROPER FORM IS IMPORTANT! And, GIVE YOURSELF A DAY TO REST BETWEEN WORKOUTS! Or, at least, do another workout video so you work different muscles.In more than four months I've made it to Level 3 and feel great! Combined with eating better I've lost 12 pounds and I feel strong and healthy.If you've absolutely never ever worked out before I recommend watching the entire video first and learning, either with a full-length mirror or investing in one session with a personal trainer, how to do proper squats and lunges. I, personally, do 10 minutes of my own yoga stretches first to open up my lower back and hips, which are very tight as a result of my weak abdominal muscles from Diastasis Recti. This helps me, but also I've worked out in the past and know how to do lunges and squats properly.Like all other exercise, you get out of it what you put into it. If you phone it in you won't get results. If you try your best and push yourself you'll soon feel ready to move up to other levels.

reviewText: OK I've bought a few workout DVDs in the past, but this is the first one I've managed to stick with. I'm 5'4" and 140 and I have zero upper arm strength. I could BARELY do one pushup with good posture, but I was able to do at least 10 by the time I was halfway through level 1! By day 7, I started seeing some serious definition in my arms, stomach, and legs.If you want to workout at home and see improvements I would buy this DVD! You'll need to buy some dumbbells, but this DVD is inexpensive and 3lb and 5lb weights were all I needed and they didn't cost much.

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I used to do The Firm workouts which typically last 45 min and never really broke much of sweat. But Jillian's 30 Day Shred leaves me dripping in sweat after only 25 min. I have been using this DVD for almost 2 weeks now and have seen a vast improvement in my endurance. I have only lost 3 pounds, but more importantly I can tell that I am getting stronger and more in shape. I started by switching between the first two levels and now I rotate doing a different level each day. Some of the moves in level 3 are too difficult for me so in order to get a full workout, I substitute those tough moves with easier ones from levels 1 and 2. Overall, these are great workouts.

reviewText: These workouts are fantastic when you've only got 20 minutes or on those days when you really have to talk yourself into working out because you'd rather go back to bed! Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: My wife and I added this to our running and core fitness regiment.  Neither of us are completely "fit", but we like to run.The workouts are hard!  Which is mostly good.  They are also short, so busy people like us can fit them in.  Each one is just over 20 minutes.  You warm up first for a couple of minutes (very important), and then you do 3 circuits that are each 6 minutes, and then you cool down/stretch for  a couple of minutes.Each 6 minute circuit is broken down into 3 minutes of strength training, 2 minutes cardio and 1 minute abs.  It's good total body exercise.  The strength portion usually incorporates upper and lower body at the same time (for instance, you might to lunges and raise your dumbells to shoulder or eye level at the same time).My wife is able to do push ups now.  She never thought she would!We've both definately dropped weight in the last 3 weeks also.  So there are results.My caution is for people who have had injuries:I've had problems with my lower back for several years now.  I think I over-strained in level 2 and needed to visit the chiropractor.  This concern isn't unique to Jillian's video.  Many exercise video's use exercises that are not good in terms of back support, and the physical trainer at my chiropractor told me that even perfectly fit people can and do throw their backs out if they exercise that way.Also, I tend to get shin splints and in the cardio portion in particular (but also because of the some of the exercises in the strength portion) you 'hammer' the calves with jumping jacks, jump rope, and other exercises that put a lot of strain on the calves.If you have week knees, there are some exercises that would put excess strain on them as well.Of this to say, if you have injuries, be careful.  You may need to seek medical advise prior to doing these exercises.The do build strength (if done so you don't injure yourself) and they do work to burn off fat.
summary: Tough workouts, get results, but maybe not for people with injuries

reviewText: I'm back in college after many years off, and it seems I've put on the "Freshman 15" and then some!!! I got tired of feeling fat all the time and squeezing into my jeans, and I've decided that enough is enough. I bought this DVD after reading some of the 800+ good reviews of it. I used to be a runner, but since school has taken over my life and I've gained all this weight, I don't feel comfortable running. Also, since it's been raining I decided that maybe indoor exercise would be better.  I used this DVD today and I have to say that I may not always have enjoyed it, but I certainly did feel it! I'm 5-foot-2 and currently sitting at around 148-150 lbs, and I am looking to lose 30. So we'll see if this DVD works. I realize it's up to me to do it consistently. Thankfully Jillian is not annoyingly bright- she's more like your hardass, workout fiend girlfriend who has nothing but positive encouragement for you. She'll remind you throughout the workout that nothing comes for free and you have to earn every inch you shrink. She keeps you moving non-stop the entire 20 minutes, and you will need some hand weights, but mine didn't come yet so I used some heavy books instead and it worked out just fine. I definitely feel it, and my muscles are a little shaky now, but I hope that's a sign that my body was challenged and I burned some calories today.  I think  the exercises were challenging but it wasn't that hard to keep it up until the last two reps. I'd get tired and slow way down, and about that time Jillian would say "Just two more, come on!" It was like she knew. I feel like I got a good workout and I'm looking forward to the next one.
summary: I can't wait to see the effects

reviewText: I see all the bad feedback as being from whiners or people who want big results from an easy workout.  Won't happen - no chance.If you want results, be prepared to work for them.  This DVD is a great addition, within the first 5 uses of the DVD I noticed an improvement in tone and stamina...there are three levels to keep you from reaching the usual plateau as quickly.  There is lots of jumping and moderate strength moves, but they work!If you have delicate health issues, ask your doctor, all DVDs say that...or modify the moves...make them lower impact...work up to it.  To me, that is common sense.  Listen to your body.All in all, this is a good part of any workout plan - a good start if you want results.

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I am new to the workout scene - approaching 40 and I "just haven't had time" for all these years. It's an excuse a lot of people use, but it really is true. I truly do not know where I would find the extra time in a day or even in a week to change clothes, drive to a gym, do a workout, drive home, etc.  A co-worker mentioned that she just gets up a little earlier and works out at home and I had an epiphany. Why couldn't I do that?So, for the last 3 months, I've been getting up 45 min-1 hour earlier and working out. I started with some DVDs I got at the local big box store - dance/aerobics/zumba type DVDs that were fun, but I found myself skipping some of the routines because they were just too long.I did a search on Amazon and Jillian's videos popped up immediately. When I heard 20 minutes, I was eager to try it. I'm SO glad I did. The 30 Day Shred is not easy, but it's not so difficult that a beginner can't do it. The first time around I tried to progress to level 2 a little too quickly and ended up hurting my knee. I took a break over Thanksgiving, did some research about form, and started over. I often follow the beginner/modified assistant, but I am still seeing results and I feel great the whole day long.I really like the structure of this workout. I also have some of the Biggest Loser DVDs, but they seem kind of loose and disorganized compared to 30 Day Shred. It's nice to see the Biggest Loser contestants doing the workouts and struggling (like me!) but I really like the professionals on Jillian's video so I know the right way to do the moves.I have finished the 30 Day Shred (lost 7 pounds in 30 days!) and I've moved on to Ripped in 30, which is very similar. I was nervous about Ripped in 30 because I loved the 30 DS so much, but so far I like it a lot, too. If you are pressed for time (or even if you aren't) but you want to tone up and feel good, Jillian's videos are definitely the way to go.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: My opinion may be completely biased, as I'm pretty loyal to The Firm series, but I ordered this DVD just to switch things up a bit.  I'm at an intermediate/advanced fitness level (I work out 5-6 days/week) so I jumped right to the Level 2 workout.  I could definitely feel the moves working and I was sweating by the time my 20 minutes were up but it was exactly what people dread when they work out.  It was not fun AT ALL.  Just work.  Some people may enjoy that (and there's nothing wrong with that!!) but in order for me to stay motivated, I need to enjoy the movements I'm doing.  If I were just trying to get a workout program going and this was the first video I attempted....I would probably run for the hills and write off exercise forever.So.....not only did I not enjoy the routine.....Jillian drove me crazy.  She did each of the movements for about 5 seconds, then hovered around the other two girls.  Her attempts to joke around with them just fizzled and the "clarifications" she gave didn't add anything for me.Lastly - the girls themselves were not moving at the same pace.  This became problematic when I would begin w/ Jillian, continue when the camera panned to girl #1 (who, typically, was still working at the same rhythm), then switched views to girl #2...who NEVER seemed to be moving at the same pace and always threw me off.So overall I think my point is clear.  I'm sure this video will give you results if the things I've described won't be bothersome to you.  Certainly not my thing!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Now, I have not done these videos for 30 days (I cannot do the same videos straight like that). I have been working out for years and actually do all 3 levels in one work out day. To my surprise level 2 burned the most calories at 320 in 30 minutes. If it was an hour long, it would definitely be my 'go to workout'. But I wake up crazy early in the morning to get my work outs in and enjoy long dvds (anywhere from an hour and a half to 2 hours a day I work out). But on days when I do videos that are an hour to an hour and a half long and need another quick one, LEVEL 2 HAS MY VOTE.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I have never in my life gotten results like I have with Jillian's 30 Day Shred!!! I stumbled across her videos on my "On Demand" menu from Comcast and have been addicted ever since! All that was available on my TV was the phase 2 and 3, so I actually never even saw phase 1 when I started :0I am not in the best shape in the world. I used to play sports but have not in the last 7 years. I am only about 10 lbs overweight but am looking to lose about 20 lbs and to completely tone up.So... I get my mat and my weights out, (I use 3 pounders), and start phase 2. Umm ya, I thought I was going to DIE!! This is a really intense workout but I did however stick with the full 20 minutes. You do really have to push yourself, Jillian says that your body can not adapt to what you want it to do if you do not push it! I do not think I have ever sweated that much in my life!Yes there are some basic moves in this seris but I have to say that they are pretty darn effective. I did 6 straight days of phase 2 and got increasingly better with each passing day. (Do not get me wrong, I still sweated up a storm and wanted to quit). After those 6 days I had only lost about 2 lbs but I could see a MAJOR difference in my body. My arms were firmer, my abs felt tighter, my love handles were a little smaller, my legs were stronger and my back... oh the best part, my back was ripped! People were also telling me my face was thinner! My clothes also were fitting better and even feeling a little loose.I had to take a week off which sucked, but I ordered the DVD and it is just fantastic. I started back up again and never bothered to look at phase 1 since I can already do phase 2. I also have only WATCHED phase 3 and have yet to actually do it but it looks hella intense!I see no problem doing part of this video everyday. Just listen to your body and be responsible, you know its limits. I actually had very minimal pain and that is what led me to do it everyday; I was barely sore at all!I have tried many things to get in shape but nothing, absolutely nothing, has given me results like this!Please do not forget that with any exercise program you must incorporate a healthy diet. If you want results you have to make sacrifices. In a world drenched in fast greasy foods, oversized portions and processed garbage galore it is hard to make good choices. reviewText: This was the first work-out dvd I've ever bought, as I've always been a runner. This dvd is essentially interval training, and is a mix of really high-impact (if you do the hard versions of the exercises) and moderate impact exercises. You really don't stop moving for 25 minutes, and it absolutely kills you- at the end of the work-out you feel like collapsing. But I absolutely love it because of the results I've gotten. I'm 5'6" and 121 pounds, and in the two weeks that I've done this dvd (5 days per week) I've lost about 50% of the excess fat I had (measured by pinch-test). It's freaking amazing. Plus, I just feel so much stronger- walking around I can feel my leg muscles moving and contracting. Plus, and possibly best of all, I've lost about 70% of my cellulite. I cannot recommend this dvd enough. Jillian has designed the perfect work-out.The only criticism I would have is that a couple of my jackets are getting tighter around the shoulders, and I don't want to look like a man, so I might scale back some of the arm weight exercises. Plus, if you have knee or ankle problems you're really going to struggle with this, as the impact on your joints is pretty big.

reviewText: I HATE jumping jacks. There, I said it!I'm in semi decent shape. I took 80 lbs off a couple years ago, managed to get into probably the best shape of my life BEFORE getting this DVD. Unfortunately put about 25 of it back on & lost diligence about working out for a while, but I'm back on the wagon & working myself back into shape. I initially bought this DVD to add to my rotation, thinking it would be a good way to change up the other things I do with yoga, belly dancing and weights. Too bad I hate jumping jacks.The good: Yes, these are good workouts, and yes, they will kick your butt. The breakdown is an interesting approach (3 segments of 6 minutes, 3 minutes strength, 2 minutes cardio, 1 minute abs). There are two girls to follow, one for the basic & modified versions, and one for the more advanced.The bad: Jumping jacks. If there is any one move in all of the exercise world that I despise above all others, its jumping jacks. And the quip about 'you won't find a modified version here, I have 400 lb people doing these' is all good and well... but that can hurt somebody if they're not careful! I don't particularly care for Jillian's methods of motivation throughout the DVD either. I thought I could work past it, because yes, it is a decent workout, and yes, you can benefit from it. However, as nice of a person as I am sure she is in real life, I can't play this DVD without wanting to throw something at her head. Sorry, Jillian, please don't take it personally. And have I mentioned I hate jumping jacks? To be honest I didn't get past level 2, and the dreaded jjs weren't as ubiquitous as they were in level 1. Lost patience and moved on to other workouts.Buy at your own discretion. If you can get past her attitude, or it doesn't bother you (and you don't mind those darned jumping jacks... really there aren't a lot of them, but I hate them anyway), its a good workout. But I've taken it out of my rotation and replaced it with Core Fusion, which I personally get more out of.

reviewText: I used to be a runner, ran marathons, was a gymrat, loved pilates, but after a knee injury and job change, running went slowly to the wayside. You do have to work hard to see results, I always pushed myself, but with sense...this isn't the 70's with the "no pain, no gain" mentality. reviewText: Jillian Michaels is using a very effective approach to weight loss:  interval training.  If you train as hard as you can for a minute or two, and then take the level down for a few minutes, and then back up again--your body will default to the higher calorie burning level.  (Maybe we really are running from a sabertooth tiger.  Let's keep it up.)However, she is trying to put too much into one exercise.  A lot of the exercises involve weight and speed.  Speed and weight separately are good things.  Together, not so much.  Weight + speed = injury.Every exercise professional that I can think of, whether it's Bryan Kest and Shiva Rea carefully placing a foot or a hand before putting weight into a difficult yoga pose, Joseph Pilates and the slower speed required by springs, or even the followers of Ken Hutchins (super-heavy, super slow), would tell you to avoid weight and speed.Unless you are one of those people who magically avoids injury, I would avoid this.Although, I wouldn't avoid interval training at all--Mari Windsor uses it in her 'dynamic sequencing', as does Callan Pinckney of Callenetics. Interval training by itself without a lot of weight is very effective for weight loss--it's a lot of why both Windsor Pilates and Callanetics were very popular.Edit:  While I'm at it, I'm going to add another complaint about this:  my experience with heavy interval training like this, is that it made me, and the clients to whom I suggested it when I was a Pilates teacher, very hungry.  We, collectively, decided that we were probably eating the difference, and thus not losing weight.However, interval training is good; just the gentler Mary-Windsor-Callan-Pinckney-variety.  If you can avoid raising your metabolism too much, interval training will help you lose weight.
summary: Not if you have injuries (or want to avoid them).

reviewText: I have been doing this video daily for the past 5 days.  I am relatively new to exercise (at least in the past couple of years), and while I am overweight, I am not obese.  I am not a weakling, but I don't have a gym membership, either.  This information is so you know where I'm coming from and also so you understand that I have only done the Level 1 workout.In short, Jillian bases her workout on a 3-2-1 principle: 3 minutes of strength, 2 minutes of cardio, 1 minute of abs.  There is a short warm-up, three 3-2-1 circuits, and a short stretch at the end, making the video a little more than 20 minutes.Jillian says that if you're going to work out in 20 minutes, you can't "phone it in."  She isn't kidding!  I was really hurting after the first day of doing this.  I was seriously sore, especially in my quads.  I have done the workout every day since, and even though I still find the workout hard, I have a bit more endurance than I did the first day and am no longer sore.  My muscles already feel generally stronger, and I am not flaking out on any of the exercises.  I will probably keep with Level 1 for a couple of weeks more before moving up to Level 2, but I will decide that when I get there, I guess.  Level 1 is tough enough for me right now.Jillian starts out in the first circuit with what I think are the hardest cardio and strength moves, push-ups (ugh) and jumping jacks (I just hate them, I don't know why).  I appreciate this because she gets the stuff I hate most out of the way in the beginning.  Don't get me wrong; the rest is super hard but somehow mentally easier!I don't have many complaints; unlike what some others have said, the music doesn't bother me, since I am too busy sweating to worry about it!  The intro to Level 1 isn't that long, and I just skip past it since I've seen it once.  The only complaint I have is that the timing of the moves does not necessarily correspond to the music, and a lot of the time Jillian is talking or demonstrating with Natalie or Anita rather than giving audio cues.  This is tough when you are doing push-ups or abs and can't exactly look at the TV!  For me, though, I go at what seems to be a reasonable pace and try to sneak glances to make sure I am keeping up with them on the video.Generally, this is NOT for the faint of heart (literally and figuratively), and this video WILL work you HARD!  If you've seen Jillian on The Biggest Loser, then you know that she doesn't fool around, and I can guarantee you won't hear any of that cheery banter most workout videos offer.I will update as I go to add my insights on Level 2 and any results!
summary: Buy Only If You Won't "Phone It In"

reviewText: Don't be fooled by anyone who claims these workouts are "20" minutes. I timed them and they are all 30 minutes. I tried the first workout after walking on my treadmill for 90 minutes and it was fairly easy. I did modify the jumping jacks because who wants to ruin their knees? Also, just when you think you are done with an exercise, it gets repeated so that makes it a bit more challenging. The exercises in the first workout include: arm crosses, windmills, jumping jacks, hip circles, push ups, squat with weights, more pushups, squat and press, jumping jacks, jumping rope, jumping jacks, crunches, reverse crunches, bicep curls with lunge, running on the spot, boxing, running, side crunches, chest flys, side lunges, jumping jacks, running on the spot, boxing, jumping rope, bicycle crunches and cooldown stretches. (30 minutes)"I want you to feel like you are going to die." ~ Jillian MichaelsThe second workout takes things up a notch. The warmup is more difficult and there is no mercy. The exercises include: arm crosses, jumping jacks, high kicks, neck circles, jumping jacks, push ups, squat with dumbbell rows, push ups, squat with dumbbell rows, running on the spot with high knees, plank, running, crunch with leg lift, static lunge, pendulum lunch (front and back lunge), static lunge, pendulum lunge, static chest press while lifting both legs, double crunches, military press with leg extensions, squats with V-raise, plank jacks (these are intense), double jump rope, plank jacks, double jump rope, abs and cooldown stretches. (30 minutes)"You've got to fight for it." ~ Jullian MichaelsThe third workout is pretty intense and again there is no mercy. If you want to adapt any of the exercises there are modifications. The exercises include: arm circles, backwards windmills, double jump rope, high kicks, butt kicks, knee circles, walking plank, superman (on stomach while lifting arms and legs), walking plank, superman, mountain climbing (plank and bringing knees into the chest), squats, mountain climbing, reverse crunch, scissor crunches, jumping lunges, boxing with dumbbells, butt kicks with dumbbells, boxing with dumbbells, jumping jacks with dumbbells, sit ups, traveling push ups, plank with leg raises, traveling push ups, plank with leg raises, jumping squats, rock star jumps, jump squats, rock star jumps, side plank raises and cooldown stretches. (30 minutes).For these workouts, I'd advise you to watch them before trying them. That will make it easier to really get into the workout and follow along quickly. These are demanding workouts designed to help you develop muscle mass. You will also increase your endurance and burn lots of calories. Sometimes two exercises are done at once to burn even more calories at one time. I'd recommend this to anyone who has already been working out for a while or to anyone who likes a challenge.~The Rebecca Review

reviewText: It is hard to submit a review for this video. I did follow it and enjoyed it - the workout flies by because she gives you no rest and you really break into a sweat. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: AS 50 yo people, this is  pretty hard,  although I have always said who needs a gym, I have rock climbed and lifted weights,  played soccer, baseball, conditioning in both,,  but as time goes on,  and work load picks up, who has time,so two 50 yo ( wife and I )  are trying this,  I would first check to see what your heart rate during exercise should be, because you are constantly moving for 20 minutes, I would watch Anita,  she does the less impact while the other gal Natalie goes through the tough part.  Jillian  walks around,I wish she would do the do' s and dont's on the very first set, holding back straight,  dont over extend the knee etc.. although I know all of it,  others might not,  also for a 50 year old I found the pace a bit fast and wished it would go to 30 minutes, I have a finger O2 and pulse checker and used it a couple of times and was sure it was too hight, esp with the BP pills I take,  I am sure if continued it would get easier.all and all a cheap and good dvd for under 10 bucks.  watched level 2 and it is quite a bit harder.  have not watched the third level yet.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Since July 2007, I've lost 18 lbs., went down from size 14 to size 8 BUT won't go down anymore. I've been stuck in this situation for more than a month now and hoping that Jillian's 30 Day Shred will break the plateau [I truly think it will!]. I eat whatever I want but I watch my portions-sensible eating as I call it!Well, I've done this 10x now and finally did Level 3 right after finishing Level 2. It's a Sunday so I have time compared to workdays. I exercise daily except Saturday, my recovery day. Normally, I'd alternate Levels 1 & 2 but Level 3 will also be part of the rotation now. At Circuit 2 Level 3, I thought I wouldn't last 'til it's over but as she said, there's no shame on switching to Anita's [beginner's] level instead of "phoning it in." Honestly, when there are hi-impact moves and they're doable on my rebounder [yes, I have it next to me] then I don't modify the moves but if it's hi-impact on a plank position, I'd follow Anita's moves. I'm 43 years old and I just want to take care of my knees. Plyometrics on a hard surface aren't for me. Initially, I did this on alternate days thinking I can't do weights everyday. However, I've read it from Q&A; in collagevideo that it's OK to do aerotone DAILY as long as I'm not lifting too heavy and it's not for a long period of time. So I just use 3s and I still feel and see the difference. I personally believe that I don't need to heavy up on weights especially on Level 3 because I have my body weight on all those planks---Level 3 has punches and jacks with weights on the cardio portion. It was really hard but I felt so good when I finished....I may increase the weights if I don't feel challenged anymore but that will take awhile....I'll give an update after I finish doing this 30x. Thanks Jillian....The needle on the scale may not be moving and I'm not down to size 4 yet but I FEEL ENERGIZED AND MUCH STRONGER.....
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: More than my arthritic body can handle.  I had hoped to be able to use this but it has proved to be too much for me.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I love Jillian Michaels' videos.  They really helped me to get back into exercising and losing weight.  This one is terrific because it is only 30 minutes.  There are three levels and each of them are good workouts in and of themselves.  I am still up to the second level.  My kids also join me sometimes.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: By production I mean DVD production only. The workouts and film production therein are great.Unfortunately DVD is designed like a typical movie with commercials.They disabled navigation to skip thru commercials and intros so you need to sit thru quite a bit of 'fat' to get to the 'meat'. But if you put in the DVD and use that time to get your shoes on and your dumbells out, you will have time for a big sip of water before the menu comes on. As for the effectiveness, I defer to the other reviews but intense old school is how I would describe. Definitely wear shoes for this one since there are cardio segments. I would suggest low weight (3lbs) dumbells since a lot of the exercises are combos but maybe keep a set of heavier ones handy too for switching out. If you got carpet, you can skip the mat too. All in all, a GREAT set of short-no-nonsense workouts for the price. This is from 2007 but I would consider a classic. I dont travel for work anymore but this would be great for that too. Most rooms have players these days or you can usually get one at the desk. The dumbells are light enuf to be practically optional and you need minimal floorspace for the routines.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I did my first day of Level 1 of the Shred this morning and it was A LOT harder than I was expecting. I've been doing Tao-Bo and Results Fitness: Boost Metabolism but Shred is harder than both and its only 20 minutes! Jillian does mostly old-school moves like jumping jacks, crunches and push ups. I have extremely weak wrists from carpel tunnel syndrome so push ups and plank poses are very hard for me. I prefer more modern approaches to cardio and strength training, but this DVD forced me to get back to basics (not sure if I like that or not yet). One thing that really annoyed me is Jillian barely does any of the exercises (maybe jumps in for the last 5, but thats it) and I prefer when the instructor does everything and talks less... (ie. Billy Blanks in Tae Bo and Tracey Staehle in Results Fitness: Boost Metabolism) I thought it was kind of a cop-out. Jillian's voice annoys me a bit too but thankfully theres an option to just have music (I'll be utilizing that once I know the work-out better) haha! I WILL be doing this work-out again but no way will I be doing it for 30 days straight. I plan to inter mingle it with my current work-out regime though. For the cost, its totally worth it. If you want a challenge and to seriously push yourself, Shred is a great start but if you're looking for a *fun* work-out that combines cardio and strength, I highly recommendResults Fitness: Boost Your Metabolism.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This workout kicks my butt!  I am halfway through level 2 right now and have lost 3 pounds.  It is a super hard, fast workout that raises your endorphin level so you feel fantastic after (like a runner's high). BUT it is hard to do everyday.  I joined a challenge on a message board that is doing 30 day shred so I am held accountable.  I do not think I would keep this up daily on my own. But I can see results and it works. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I am on day 29 of the 30-Day Shred and let me tell you -- it has been incredible! I'm a 29-year-old mother of two and have been trying for the past six months to take off the last 25 pounds of baby weight. Before I bought this video, I had been working out for an hour and a half a day -- biking and using the Biggest Loser workout videos. In five months, I had lost nine pounds. Not bad, right? Well, in 29 days of Jillian's 30-Day Shred (at 30 minutes a day), I have lost eleven pounds. Of course, this is in conjunction with a healthy, low-calorie diet, but still! Incredible results!As others have said, these workouts are INTENSE so start slow. Jillian offers beginner modifications for some of the more difficult moves, so don't give up. I had a knee injury (patellar tracking problem) a few months ago that would start acting up every time I exercised. Now, though, my muscles are so strong that my knee never hurts at all. Thanks Jillian!

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I deleted my original review since I initially bought this DVD a few years back, but did not keep up with it for more than a few days.  Now I have a true incentive to use it.  Please read below:***UPDATED 3/7/12***I have gained 8 lbs in the past two years, and am sick of feeling flabby and gross.  8 lbs may not sound like much, but when you're only 5 feet tall, TRUST ME when I say it can feel like 15-20 lbs on a person who is of average height or tall.Now, I want to start by saying that I believe my weight gain has been largely caused by taking different SSRI's over the past year (antidepressants - Celexa and Zoloft).  Unfortunately, many people gain weight while taking these meds and even more disconcerting is the fact that people say it's basically impossible to take that weight off while still taking the med.  In my case, I have found this to be true.  I have tried diets such as eating very low carb or meticulously counting calories, and my exercise consisted of running on the treadmill as well as doing pilates and/or yoga dvds. All of these things would have, in the past before I was taking meds, immediately given me a 4-5 lb loss, no problem.  However, currently no amount of change in my diet or exercise has made any difference in my weight, inches or tone.  Bottom line, I am feeling super bummed out and helpless.I've decided to commit to the 30 Day Shred as my last resort.  I bought it a few years back, but didn't use it regularly, as I was more or less satisfied with my body at that time, and had no real incentive.  I am worried because I feel like I will be INCREDIBLY disappointed if even THIS doesn't work, in terms of changing my body!  But I am committed to trying it.  I am on Day 4, and I do feel stronger but have not noticed any change in how my clothes feel.  I realize it's still very early on, so I'm not letting it get me down.  I will update this review as I go along.For those folks out there who have gained weight due to SSRI's (or other medications) and can't seem to lose the weight no matter what, I hear ya.  I hope that by tracking my progress in this review that it will bring hope to those who are in a similar situation and feel powerless to control their body weight and tone.  Hopefully I will have positive news to report, haha!  I'll be updating every few sessions.I took my measurements & weight on Day 1, and I won't be checking in on my progress with either of those until Day 30.  The main reason for this is that I don't want to become discouraged if I don't see the numbers I'm hoping for.DAY 4: On Level 1. No noticeable change in how my clothes fit.  However, I do feel stronger and feel that I have more endurance to do the workout.DAY 7: On Level 1.  Although there is still no difference in how my pants fit, my thighs definitely feel tighter and my butt feels more lifted.  I do notice a difference in my abs, for sure - they're less poochy.  Unfortunately, since I have IBS-C, I am always bloated / distended to some degree, and have gotten used to looking anywhere between 3 and 8 months pregnant at any given time depending on what's going on with my body (funny & sad, but true!).  Anyway, I've noticed that there does not appear to be as much flab on my stomach, and the muscles are tighter and are holding in the bloating better :)  The initial soreness from this workout has faded, and I'm excited every morning to get out of bed and do it.DAY 10: Began Level 2. Teensy bit of difference in how my pants fit - almost negligible, 1/4" maybe?  Still feeling like I'm getting stronger and building endurance. I don't like the exercises in Level 2 as much as Level 1, and so it might be harder for me to get through this phase.  It still had me drenched in sweat, of course.DAY 15: On Level 2. Same teensy bit of difference in how my clothes fit - slightly looser.  I had high hopes that I would have gone down 2 pants sizes by now (haha), but no such luck.  I am continuing to get stronger, and can especially feel the firmness in my abs.  I'm thinking it will probably take me more than 30 days to see results, given my whole situation with being on meds.  But, I'm trying to remain positive - after all, I am building muscle and getting rid of fat - even if it's verrrry slowly - so that can't be a bad thing.

reviewText: This workout is brilliant, mostly because it's QUICK.
