reviewText: I have owned this DVD for over a year now and it is my favorite workout DVD of all time.  It seems that most people I know also own it - I am always meeting people from all walks of life that own this DVD.  It reminds me of the Jane Fonda craze of the early 80s!  Why is it my favorite workout DVD of all time, among all that I have owned over the past decade?  That's why I'm here to write this review.Jillian Michaels has always been an inspiration to me.  She is a strong, tough, and beautiful woman and is about my same age.  So, when I heard she had a DVD, I bought it.There are three 20-minute workouts on the DVD, intended to be done 10 times at each level.  By the third workout, you are doing mountain climbers and plank!  I found that Level III wasn't significantly more difficult than Level I, so some users may wish to alternate the workouts rather than proceed sequentially.  Supposedly you would be "shredded" if you did all those workouts in a month.  How I admire anyone that can actually do 30 workouts in 30 days!  When I was kid-less, I would be doing other types of workouts (dance rehearsals, long walks, other vids) - and now I just can't find the time every day!  However, I am still trying to do 10 of each workouts even if I can't make it every day.  Currently I am up to #9.  It's hard work!  If you keep at it, you will find yourself getting stronger and your form improving.The theory is that you do 3 minutes of strength, 2 of high-intensity cardio and 1 of abs.  In the strength portion, you alternate between a heavy-duty single-muscle strength move and a move that combines upper & lower body.  In the cardio portion, there are usually 2 cardio moves, like jumping jacks and jump rope and you alternate every 30 seconds.  My favorite part of course is abs - you get to lie on the floor and do some variety of crunches.  It keeps your interest with the variety, doesn't wear any particular part out too much, and you know that if you don't like it, it will be over soon at least.Jillian's pitter patter is motivating.  She tells you that you have to work out  hard to get results, that you can do it if some of the people she trains on Biggest Loser can do it, and that you're going to get results if you keep at it.  She also has  Anita demonstrating an easier version and Nathalie doing a harder version, so that within one workout, you can adjust to your abilities.The workout is great for anyone, but it's particularly great for moms.  I used this DVD frequently before I was a mom, stopped while I was pregnant (too high impact), and started again once I was given the go-ahead to exercise.  The 20 minute workouts are perfect to fit in during your child's naps.  It can still be difficult to find that 20 minutes, after all, you still have to get your workout clothes on!  My only criticism is the LONG introduction at the beginning of the DVD that cannot be skipped.  Typically I turn on the DVD player and the Wii, do my Wii Fit Body Test, and by the time I'm done, the DVD is ready for me to choose a workout.

reviewText: Wow, I really like this DVD and her Kickboxing Fast Fix. I own the Ripped in 30 DVD too but didn't like it. reviewText: Update: Not good for bad knees, ankles and wrists. I thought I could build up to these exercises, but I'm sticking to low impact mat workouts. So this week I'm seeing how only working out for half the time works out for me...I bought this because the workouts are 20 minutes or so long--I love getting in cardio and toning done in half an hour, and I do feel like it's been working (ie, I'm sort of in pain--in a good way--on day 6!). Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This workout DVD is awesome.  I bought this to shake up my exercise routine, and to get in more strength training during my week.  Jillian has three different leveled workouts on one DVD, which I find great--I alternate my regular cardio workouts with Jillian's workouts every other day, doing different levels of her workout on those alternate days.  She also does three minutes of strength, 2 minutes of cardio, and 1 minute of abs in each circuit, with 3 circuits total in each workout.  I have seen improved results in my strength levels, and am getting a little ripped to boot!  I have tried a LOT of other systems that combine cardio and strength (such as P90X), but this one gets the same work done in a MUCH shorter amount of time (each video is about 27 minutes long, compared to the hour and fifteen minutes P90X workouts usually lasted).  Since I get up early and work out before I go to work, these workouts let me sleep in a little more and get the same results. The moves are easy to follow, and there are no complicated moves to learn.  You just need a set of dumbbells and a mat.  I would recommend this DVD to anyone who wants a great strength training workout in a short period of time.  You'll get results!

reviewText: I got this DVD back in the spring and made the mistake of using heavier weights than Jillian. I was already in good shape but wanted to be "shredded". Bad move! The heavier weights are unnecessary with all of the plyometrics. My body began to break down, literally, from overwork (swelling and loss of tone). After a break of 2 months, I tried it again. I've been doing level 2 and I love it. I honestly think it's one of the best most effective 25-27 minute workouts I've ever owned. And I have a fairly vast library of workout DVDs, nearly 50 in total. I feel wonderful while doing level 2 and I've seen great results in my arms, shoulders and back with only 3 lb weights. It's amazing. I've been able to see definition in my abs that I haven't seen before, even at the most fit points in my life. And this is post pregnancy, that's unexpected! :-)Level 3 on the other hand, has lots of jumping and pushups but the arms/back portion with weights is weaker. Be careful here, I hurt myself with the jumping lunges - a strained soaz muscle. The jumps are extremely high impact. Much of level 3 does not seem as difficult or challenging (to me) as level 2 apart from the jumping. I found this portion of the DVD perplexing, the mixture of exercises just doesn't make sense. So now I do level 2 and then add a few things from level 3 - the superman moves are excellent. Even if you never progress to level 3 you'll have a kick butt workout and you *will* see a difference if you stick with it. I found that I have had better results when I do the workout(s) 4-5 days a week and allow my body to repair rather than daily as Jillian recommends.
summary: This works! ...but some of the "level" exercise are questionable
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: What a workout! I've been using this dvd, rotating it with a few others, for almost a year now and it still makes me sweat. Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: This workout DVD is one of the best, if not the best, on the market.  I am in my mid-20s and I enjoy a fitness challenge, but I am in law school so I do not have a lot of time.  The first time I did it, I had just run my final marathon and I was looking for something that I could realistically have time to do during exams. Even though I had good cardio, I was looking for something more and this video was EXTREMELY challenging for me. These workouts, with warm up and cool down, clock in around 26:00.  If you are up at 6 you can be in the shower by 6:30 and still get a very challenging workout in.  Unfortunately, I did not eat as well as I could have the first time I did "the shred." I lost a lot of inches but not a lot of pounds, because I was still carbing up (hard habit to break).  However, I was very happy with the way I looked by the end, because the toning in this video is very effective.This time around, I ate right (stuck to a 1300 calorie per day diet- I am 5'2) and the results have been even better.  The videos are still challenging even though I just did this about a year ago, but I notice more definition coming out in my abs and arms, probably because it is not covered with bloat/fat :)  It is very rewarding and motivating to see so much of a difference in a short amount of time.  I have been losing 3 lbs/week, which is right where I want to be.Here are a few ways to make the workouts more challenging:(1) once you know the sequence of the moves, you can really jump right into the next move without waiting for Jillian and the girls to start.  Usually she moves along at a good clip, but other times I can find I get as many as 10 reps in while she is doing the set up.  Of course, you just need to make sure your form is good.  You will be amazed how this "adds up" and makes you more tired at the end.(2) go faster! You might be able to hit extra jumping jacks without sacrificing form.(3) Once you know the harder variations, go for it.  For example, I did double jump rope (from level 2) in level 1 when I did this for the second time.In addition, to increase effectiveness, I think adding a cardio session a few days a week and sticking to a diet really helps to augment this program. These are two very different approaches but they both work. As I said, I did it the first time without any tweaks and I was still very happy with the result.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: So I just worked out to this video for the first time, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I don't necessarily want to see the numbers on my scale go down, I just want my clothes to fit better. I have heard so much about this DVD, I decided to check it out (from the library that is)I am pretty athletic, I bike 20-50 miles 3-4 times a week, with rides up to 100 miles some weeks, I do a weight training DVD (Jari Love - I adore her workouts) twice a week, and I walk or hike 3-5 miles at least once a week (at a 4mph pace) So I thought, "How could this 20 minute workout be enough to really challenge me and make me feel like I have really worked out?"  Well, right now I can barely lift my arms to type this review, and I am still perspiring from the workout.  As others have said, I certainly found myself asking, "Are we there yet?! Is this over, for goodness sake?!" But then, a minute or two later, we were done - it really does fly by.The cardio exercises seem high impact - I have had problems with my knees in the past when I was training for a marathon, and I found ice and stretching after running really helped keep my knees from getting sore (minor tear in the meniscus).  If I find this workout hurts my knees, I will ice and stretch after the workout.I also offer these pieces of advice:If you aren't sure about this DVD, get it from the library or Netflix before you buy it (I found many of Jillian Michaels' DVDs at the library)!I also recommend, if you are a woman, wearing a sports bra for the workout... just sayin'...I recommend wearing a good pair of running shoes, better for the cardio.I found 2.5lb weights to be adequate for the first time, even though I use 6lb weights for my other weight training DVDs.  I thought it would be too light, but by the end of the workout, I could barely lift the 2.5lb above shoulder height.Fortunately I had a bottle of water nearby.  Even though I drank a liter of water a couple hours ago, I was absolutely parched about halfway through the workout.I'm planning to do this workout every day, and keep biking (my truest love) and I will update this review in a few weeks.Update 6/13/2012:After the first week I lost 5 pounds, but I also monitored my calorie intake and purposely decreased my calories.  I noticed some changes in how my clothes fit and how I looked after two weeks, but I haven't lost any more weight (poundage) since the first week, in spite of working out every day and cutting calories.My arms and legs are definitely more toned, my waist more defined, and my abs a little flatter.  I can't say I am "Shredded" but I must be honest and say I never made it to Level 3 - I liked Level 2 so much, I stayed there for 20 days.I feel good and I love this workout DVD.  I will use it for days when I am really pressed for time but still want to work up a good sweat.I want to re-emphasize the need to wear good shoes for the workout - I am certain that I would be having knee pain if I didn't wear my running shoes to do this DVD - the cushioning and stability are a must for the moves you do.  So far I don't have any knee pain and for this I am very grateful!  As for doing this workout every day - my opinion, and I am not an exercise physiologist, is that if you keep the weight light, it really is OK.  It's when you use weights to feel a real burn that you need to let the muscles recover for about 36-48 hours.  I use a 2.5lb (1kg) weight and I don't feel a burn, just a good workout.

reviewText: I have to thank my friends for recommending this DVD to me.  WOW, I have never had such quick results from a workout!I had a second baby and as most people say, it's harder to take the weight off the second time, so this DVD was exactly what I needed to get my body back into shape.  I did not follow the "directions" and do it every day.  The first time I did level 1 I had never worked out so hard, or ever been so sore!  (and I'm not a novice exerciser!)  But I kept at it, every few days, or every other day.  Basically I do it 2-3 days a week, and on off days do some other cardio.  I stayed with level 1 for a while, but then moved to level 2, where I thought I would never make it through!  However, same thing, every other day or so I did the routine and of course by now I had already been seeing results, but I started losing faster, I think because it's a more intense workout. reviewerName: Trish "A Sun Salutin', Crochet Hookin' Chick!"
reviewText: I have three other Biggest Loser Instructor DVD's--The Biggest Loser Season 1, The Biggest Loser Cardio Max, and The Power Sculpt.  This is my least favorite of all.First, I think a 2 minute warm-up is not sufficient for the workout (6 circuits of 2 minutes strength, 2 minutes cardio, 1 minute abs) that follows. Personally, I wish the the ab work was a standing ab type circuit only because after the cardio circuit, your heartrate if fairly high and then you pop right on your back for abs...I'm not a fitness expert, but I have about 100 exercise DVD's and most allow your heartrate to decline before doing floorwork.  It's too much strain on your heart.I also think that the circuits are too short to really burn enough fat to lose weight.  If this DVD were customizable (like the Cardio Max and Power Sculpt) then the viewer could do 2 circuits in a row (excluding the warm-up in between) and get a good workout.There are good points to the DVD--good instruction, using upper/lower body moves at the same time to raise the heart rate, and no annoying chatter, but when compared to the other Biggest Loser Series Instructors, this is the least useful for me.

reviewText: I didn't weigh myself at the start of the Shred but reckon I stood at 90kg.This is my second go at the Shred. I quit the first time to protect my knees (thinking I would first shift some kilos using Slim in Six and then attempt it again). This time round I have decided to not give up unless my knees give out. I plan to do it five or six days a week; two weeks per level. I'm adding Leslie Sansone walks (so that I don't have to diet), 10 Minute Solution ab workouts and plenty of stretching.As for my diet, I don't really deny myself, but I like healthy food, so I think I eat well most of the time.WEEK ONE: A week ago, my waistline measured 36.5" and hips about 50". I was thrilled to see my waistline shrink to 35.5" and hips 49.75". When I did Slim in Six --- I lasted four weeks on that --- I was losing a half inch a week so losing an inch is a huge accomplishment, and in only five days.WEEK TWO: Waist - 34" (I'm stunned!)  Hips - 49"Instead of adding two miles this week I did three, and on Wednesday actually interval trained withLeslie Sansone's 5K with a Twist! I had my last chance workout yesterday (Saturday) which comprised of a 5-min warm-up and then 10 minutes of abs, Level One and Leslie's Three Fast Miles. Last Saturday I was dying using a two-mile. I hoped I could do three a week later with gusto but I was still dying! However, my performance has definitely improved and whereas I can't move up to Level Two just yet I'm almost ready to keep up with the girls (I follow both, depending on the move itself).PS: My knees are doing much better than when I started; I'm glad I didn't use them as my excuse to not Shred.PPS: Last week I was ecstatic to not see my belly while standing and looking down my sports bra. Today I can't see it peeping through my T-shirt! Yay!WEEK THREE: Waist - 34"  Hips - 49"Alas! It's been sooo cold this week. I did the Shred four times, abs and three miles twice, two miles once and little stretching. I had a cream doughnut and carrot cake (on separate days!). I weighed myself yesterday (Saturday) and was well over 90kg! I want to believe I've gained muscle and maybe water (I take Glucosamine for the knees and have read it increases water retention) but I am a little disappointed that I'm so heavy.Nevertheless, good things happened this week: I fit into a UK 14 shirt, and my workout shorts began to ride up and down my waist. I'm STILL on my way to being shredded!WEEK FOUR, FIVE, SIX... I LOST COUNT: Waist - 33" Hips - 48"The struggle continues. I'm happy to have managed to shave off another inch although I've not exercised consistently. This slump is nothing new. My body typically rebels a month into a weight loss programme; cravings kick in and death row is more enticing than exercise. I'm trying to motivate myself with the memory of how good I felt after working out and on Sundays when I measured myself. Jillian once said via podcast that when the slump happens, one should give oneself permission to take a break. Although her slump lasted seven days and here I am, several weeks later, still slumped.UPDATE: I give up. Kinda. I have now progressed to Level Two, albeit never mastering Level One, because I hoped that the novelty would keep me going. But Level Two is just so hard that I've decided to stick to Level One and add other DVDs to make a rotation. Maybe I'll try all three levels some time in 2011... and I'm STILL on my way to being shredded!UPDATE, JANUARY 2013: I did it! I finally did all three levels of the 30 Day Shred! I only barely mastered Level One, but I'm happy with my performance on all levels because I did things I never thought I could do! I am still very heavy, about 95kg, so I'm positive that the lighter I become, the better I will perform.Unfortunately, I only lost 2kg in the four months I Shredded, and I'm still wearing my regular clothes. I was hoping to be much further along. This time my diet was not good: too many carbs, not enough protein. I've only just corrected my diet, but after four months of the Shred, I've moved on. I still recommend this workout because it does work you out and improve fitness. I believe my results were atypical.
summary: Well on my way to being Shredded!

Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: As someone who has previously lost 60 lbs and gained back about 20, I've been looking for a way to jumpstart my losses again, particularly inches.I decided to give this work out a try. I just finished up day 4, and I have to say I already feel much better, stronger, and my pants aren't digging into my tummy anymore. I don't expect to have as dramatic a pound loss as the package claims, but this is definitely a good starting place. It's also very good if you're short on time.I did have to take 3 days off after day 1 because my muscles (particularly lower body) were so sore. But, picking it up again gets a little easier every day, and I am also combining it with 30-40 minutes of cardio and a lower calorie diet.I gave it 4 stars simply because I feel that the cooldown/stretch session is not adequate. I do add my own stretches afterwards, but for someone who is a beginner, and may not know much about setting up a proper work out, I suggest doing research on different cool down stretches.All in all, I do recommend this DVD if you're looking for a quick, all-over body work out :)
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: Maybe it's just me because so many people seem to love Jillian, but I can't understand why.  I consider myself an intermediate/advanced exerciser, and I've tried several of her DVDs but just can't get into it.  She wastes a lot of time talking (even though she says she's not going to), and spends a lot of time pointing out how awesome the girls in the video look.  And I get sick of hearing about how tough of a trainer she is.If you can get past that, the workout itself isn't that great.  To me it was boring and poorly sequenced.  The moves are really high impact, which I usually like but they just weren't fun in this video.  I didn't see enough variety, and I felt almost nothing from her abs sections.  The cardio segments were lacking and didn't really get my heart rate up; they were more like faster strength moves.  And with the strength, it feels like she doesn't work all of the muscle groups and overemphasizes other; for example there are way too many moves that have you on all-fours or in a pushup position (in all the sections).  A MUCH better DVD is Cindy Whitmarsh's 10 Days to a Better Body.
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: A terrific workout in 3 levels: 1, 2 and 3.  Each workout is about 20 minutes with a 5-minute warm up and a 5-minute cool down.  Start with level 1 and gradually progress until you get to level 3.  You will work hard and you will see results from this DVD!
Title: Jillian Michaels - 30 Day Shred

reviewText: I bought this mainly because each workout is short, and even with how busy I am, I can stick in 27 minutes somewhere. Even starting at the first level, this workout is surprisingly intense. It gave me quick results as far as weight loss, and I did build my endurance quickly (who knew 1 minute of jumping jacks would be that tiring at first?) I love how you switch between activities enough that the time flies by. I use this as a little extra workout at home if I can't get to the gym, or if I just need a little boost.
summary: Great daily nugget of a workout
